description: Made from 100% Cabernet Sauvignon, this is bright and intense, and it shows notes of dark fruit, spice, leather, prune, rum cake and tobacco, plus aged aromas of black licorice and cured meat. Fine, dusty tannins mark the close.
title: Carpineto 2005 Farnito Cabernet Sauvignon (Toscana)

description: This is a lovely example of the vineyard's strengths: It has ripe, mouth-filling flavors of cherry and cassis, which are set in an iron-like framework and accented by chalk and clay notes. It's balanced, and it will benefit from cellaring for up to a decade.
title: Cadence 2009 Tapteil Red (Red Mountain)

description: Made from estate-vineyard fruit, this is a blend of three-quarters Cabernet Sauvignon, with Cabernet Franc, Merlot and Petit Verdot. Each new vintage seems to bring a bit more depth to the wine, and the flavors of berry and plum remain fresh, with a gentle kiss of new oak.
title: Cadence 2009 Cara Mia Vineyard Camerata Red (Red Mountain)

description: A sophisticated, oak-aged Viognier, this delivers smooth aromas of apricot, candied fruit, white peppercorn and almond skin. The palate is equally generous, dense and rich.
title: Michele Satta 2010 Giovin Re Viognier (Toscana)

description: Firm and powerful, this tannic wine has dense black-fruit flavors, with enough fruitiness to balance the structure. The finish shows a smoky character, a bitter cherry flavor and bright acidity.
title: L. Tramier & Fils 2010 Collection Premier Cru  (Pommard)

description: This focused effort features fresh-cut apple and pear flavors that are spicy and tightly wrapped with a Bourbon-barrel-like accent. Delicious now, but it can be cellared for a decade at least.
title: Januik 2010 Cold Creek Vineyard Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This is the winery's first Petit Verdot, and it's a beauty. Firm and muscular, it has plenty of blackberry and black cherry flavors hanging on its tannic bones. The finish shows a smack of dark chocolate, and the overall structure suggests that this will age for 15 years or more.
title: Spring Valley Vineyard 2010 Sharilee Petit Verdot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: While this doesn't quite rival the great 2007, it is superior to the 2008. Rich, concentrated and structured, this has forward black-cherry, chocolate, anise and sandalwood flavors that are wrapped in firm but smooth, supple tannins. It should develop in the bottle over the next six years, but it can also be consumed now.
title: Rutherford Hill 2009 Reserve Merlot (Napa Valley)

description: While this wine has the crispness of Chablis, it also has weight and concentration. The bright green-apple flavor is underpinned by a sense of minerality. Nervy, tense yet fruity, this can age for 2â€šÃ„Ã¬3 years.
title: Olivier Leflaive 2010 Fourchaume Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: An elegant yet ripe wine, this comes laced with citrus acidity, and the yellow fruit and melon flavors give it a sense of richness. It's lively and crisp, and it has a toasty base. Age it for 3â€šÃ„Ã¬4 years.
title: Olivier Leflaive 2010 Clos Saint-Marc Premier Cru  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: Polished and balanced, this masterpiece shows restraint and it's already drinkable. With its great acidity and its fine intermingling of spice and red fruit flavors, this wine will appeal to lovers of Gamay and Pinot Noir.
title: Navarro 2010 MâˆšÂ©thode âˆšâ€  l'Ancienne Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: Luca D'Attoma, the proprietor of Duemani, is a strictly biodynamic winemaker and a leading figure in Italy's natural wine movement. This wine shows pristine red fruit notes, backed by delicate, spicy tobacco and leather touches.
title: Duemani 2010 Cifra Red (Toscana)

description: Smooth and round, this wine is made from grapes that were sourced from the southernmost vineyards of the CâˆšÂ¥te d'Or. It has a soft, rich and fruity character that shows citrus and white peach flavors, plus a pineapple hint. As it opens, it becomes opulent and full bodied.
title: Domaine de Bellene 2010 Les Charmes Dessus  (Santenay)

description: An elegant wine, this is full of ripe black-fruit flavors, and it has a rich, velvety texture. The acidity and minerality give this wine a sense of structure that promises good aging potential.
title: Domaine Champy 2010 Les Taillepieds Premier Cru  (Volnay)

description: A pure-tasting wine, this has a mineral character, tight, balanced acidity and lemon and white-fruit flavors. One of the rare white wines from the CâˆšÂ¥te de Nuits, this has power and a toasty element.
title: Domaine Bruno Clair 2010 En la rue de Vergy  (Morey-Saint-Denis)

description: The Te Muna Road section of Martinborough is the same region exploited by Craggy Range and Escarpment, so Cobblestone's American owners are in good company. Only the second release of this wine, the 2010 is a plush, sexy example, featuring a combination of fruity and savory components. Black cherry fruit pushes through complex notes of smoke, sous bois and shiitake mushrooms. Drink nowâ€šÃ„Ã¬2020.
title: Cobblestone 2010 Te Muna Pinot Noir (Martinborough)

description: An 80-20 blend of Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah, this shows a pristine, polished bouquet that's composed of black fruit, rum cake, licorice, tobacco and spice. The ripe fruit and cassis notes on the finish add softness and heft. This is elegant and complex, especially in the mouth.
title: Cipriana 2009 Scopaio  (Bolgheri)

description: This rosâˆšÂ©â€šÃ„Ã®a blend of Tempranillo and Grenacheâ€šÃ„Ã®is light on flavor. A thin note of watermelon and a hint of peach pit quickly fade.
title: Ott & Murphy 2011 Chanson RosâˆšÂ© (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Fruity, ripe and round, this is simple Chardonnay that gives pleasure from its warm texture and softness. The apple flavor leads to a gentle finish.
title: LupâˆšÂ©-Cholet 2010  Bourgogne

description: This starts off feeling soft and open, but the acids gain momentum on the midpalate, lending plenty of zip. A mild, oak-influenced plum flavor marks the quick-to-fade finish.
title: VivâˆšÂ°c Winery 2008 V. Single Vineyard Syrah (New Mexico)

description: There's virtually no bouquet to this wine, and the palate follows suit with a flat feel and hollow, faded flavors of balsamic-doused cherry and herb. It seems aged and dried out.
title: Finca Vieja 2004 Reserva Tempranillo (La Mancha)

description: A hit of sulfur slowly blows off to reveal aromas of hot stone and maple syrup, with undertones of dark stone fruit and dill. The medium-bodied palate offers soft acids that lend a slightly flat feel, with mild tannins adding some support.
title: Brys 2010 Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Old Mission Peninsula)

description: A blend of 70% Cabernet Franc and 30% Merlot, this feels a little light on flesh, providing little cushion to the high acids. A campfire smokiness underscores the rusty dark-fruit note, which ultimately finishes a bit short.
title: 2 Lads 2009 Cabernet Franc-Merlot (Old Mission Peninsula)

description: Open and simple, this has a light touch of citrus fruit, with an edge of wood in the background. It is bright and ready to drink.
title: Domaine Patrick Javillier 2010 CuvâˆšÂ©e Oligocene  (Bourgogne)

description: Aromas of rubber, toasted herb and desiccated dark fruit are quite mute and reticent. On the palate, the structural elements are prominent, with juicy acids and astringent tannins framing the dark berry flavor.
title: Boxwood 2010 Trellis Red (Virginia)

description: A leathery, herbal aroma outmuscles the distant berry and cherry scents. It feels hard and high in acidity, with raspberry and snappy red-plum flavors. It's citrusy and crisp on the finish, with lasting tang.
title: Finca Vieja 2010 Tempranillo (La Mancha)

description: This is sharp smelling, with aromas of field greens, rhubarb and scratchy spices. It's light in weight, with short, herbal and spicy flavors that center on a strawberry note.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y Leâˆšâ‰¥n
title: El Furioso 2009 Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y Leâˆšâ‰¥n)

description: Forward and fruity, this allies fresh, upfront apple and citrus fruits with acidity. Light, bright and crisp, it offers pleasurable drinkability.
title: Sylvain Dussort 2010 CuvâˆšÂ©e des Ormes  (Bourgogne)

description: Light strawberry fruit is quickly overtaken with bitter, stemmy flavors and thick, heavy tannins.
title: Page Cellars 2008 Libra Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Using grapes sourced from the Klipsun Vineyard, this disappointing effort is stemmy and tannic, with a bitter finish.
title: Page Cellars 2007 Syrah (Red Mountain)

description: Muffled, shy aromas are redolent of cherries, dried flowers and pear drops. Soft and rounded, the palate has a sweet quality about its core, with mild acids and a dusting of tannins.
designation: Fleur du Vin Fruity Semi Dry
title: Les Bourgeois NV Fleur du Vin Fruity Semi Dry Red (Missouri)

description: Wooly aromas of white orchard fruit and toasty peanut shell define the nose. On the palate, zesty acids propel the modest white-peach flavor, leading to a slightly short but clean finish.
title: Les Bourgeois 2011 Solay White (Missouri)

description: The basic Chardonnay here is nice, with citrus, pear and pineapple fruit flavors. But the oak weighs heavily, bringing a caramelized, butterscotch candy sweetness. Lots of people will like it for exactly that reason.
title: JustNat 2010 Natalie's Crown Reserve Chardonnay (Dry Creek Valley)

description: As you might infer from the name, this tastes sweet. It appeals to consumers who enjoy the trend of sugary red wines. You could almost drink it as a dessert sipper, with its candied blackberry and cherry flavors.
title: Jellybean Wines 2010 Candy-Apple Red Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: Gaseous and minerally on first blush, it has funky, earthy aromas of leaves and olive that could use a hit of freshness. It feels grabby and scratchy, with an olive flavor and a hot finish that has a latex-like character. This is a big wine that misses some elegance.
title: MarquâˆšÂ©s de Valdueza 2009 Valdueza Red (Extremadura)

description: Scents of old coffee, cherry and caramel follow through on the palate, with a soapy hint that adds a slightly bitter element This is a medium-bodied, no-frills wine that should pair just fine with a grilled pork chop.
title: Adirondack Winery NV Barbera (America)

description: Soft and open, this has ripe fruits that are lightly textured and gently attractive. The acidity that shows on the finish gives the wine definition, but its softness is likely to be the dominant character.
title: Domaine George 2010 Vieilles Vignes  (Chablis)

description: A little rustic and tattered around the edges, but its dry, with ripe blackberry flavors that veer into tannic, bitter raisin skins. Drink this with a hamburger to round it out.
title: Chessman 2010 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)

description: An easy effort, this has aromas of pear, white peach and white flower. The bright, perky acidity energizes the medium- to full-bodied palate, with a honeyed toasted-nut note marking the finish.
title: Bogati 2011 Viognier (Virginia)

description: Soft and fruity, this has apple and citrus flavors, with a touch of vanilla. It is light, fragrant and crisp; ready to drink.
title: AndrâˆšÂ© Guichot 2010  Bourgogne

description: Using grapes sourced from a Red Mountain vineyard, this pure Cabernet seems to have been overripened. Notes of raisin and prune appear on the nose and palate, and the mouthfeel is chalky and a bit flat.
title: Page Cellars 2007 Preface Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Mountain)

description: There's not much going on here beyond lots of smoky, caramelized oak and some easy peach and citrus flavors. A touch of unripeness is also found. Chardonnnay has not been ZD's strong suit, and still isn't.
title: ZD 2010 Reserve Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: White cherry, raspberry, almond skin and cola describe the simple bouquet of this easy-going red. On the palate, it's crisp and lean.
title: Zanoni 2010  Valpolicella

description: Bright and easy, this has direct aromas and flavors of red cherry and raspberry. It's light in weight, with low tannins and a short but clean finish. Drink now.
title: Wamakersvallei 2010 Bain's Way Shiraz (Wellington)

description: This is a juicy, red-currant-flavored wine. With its round feel and soft, smoky tannins, it has an initial smoothness that is given some bite by the red-berry acidity on the finish.
title: L. Tramier & Fils 2010  Hautes CâˆšÂ¥tes de Nuits

description: This sparkler is sweet but attractive and balanced, with a lovely lychee, peach and rose water aromatic profile. The carbonation is not overly assertive, and the acidity is brisk enough to keep the finish from coming off as cloyingly sweet.
designation: Star Tree CuvâˆšÂ©e Brulsand Doux Sparkling Wine
title: Orange River Wine Cellars NV Star Tree CuvâˆšÂ©e Brulsand Doux Sparkling Wine Sparkling (Northern Cape)

description: On the lean side, this taut and crisp red-currant-flavored wine is dominated by acidity and dry tannins. It seems to miss out on generosity.
title: Domaine Poulleau PâˆšÂ®re et Fils 2010 Les Mondes Rondes  (CâˆšÂ¥te de Beaune)

description: Initially a rather subdued Frog; as if it has been tamed down. Then, suddenly, There's a plush core of blackberry fruit, and the classic Cayuse funkiness is there, drenched in liquid rocks and cured meat and drying tannins. It's all in proportion and a fine reflection of the steely vintage. As it opens gracefully you discover that it is a stunningly refined Frog, quite possibly the best ever; powerful and distinctive, but also elegant, feminine.
title: Cayuse 2008 Bionic Frog Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: While it doesn't have huge power, this wine does have many great attributes. It is smoothly ripe, its open structure a fine reflection of the elegant style, edged with minerality. The acidity is pure, not too dominant, but lifting the generous fruit and final dry character.
title: Domaine de Chevalier 2006  Pessac-LâˆšÂ©ognan

description: Earthy and rustic, this Pinot Noir is lightweight, with a hint of red cherry. There is an unpleasant bitter aftertaste.
title: La Cave des Vignerons de Pfaffenheim 2009 Pinot Noir (Alsace)
winery: La Cave des Vignerons de Pfaffenheim

description: A cat-pee, grassy Sauvignon Blanc that's a little long in the tooth.
title: Cedar Mountain 2008 Blanche's Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Livermore Valley)

description: This Valpolicella blend opens with an aged, browning color and etched aromas of dried fruit and almond. The wine seems past its prime already.
title: Cantine Benedetti 2008 Corte Antica  (Valpolicella Classico Superiore)

description: Less adequate than in the past. The wine lacks aromatic zest and pungency before showing tart apple and ultimately vegetal flavors. Canned pea notes are prevalent.
title: Santa Rita 2010 120 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

description: Smells distinctly like juniper, hot brush and stemmy black fruit. The palate feels tough and stemmy, and the flavors are bitter and weedy. Just doesn't seem ripe. Weak for Chile's de facto Malbec leader.
title: Viu Manent 2010 Estate Collection Malbec (Colchagua Valley)

description: Vegetal and dull, with asparagus and raspberry flavors.
title: Hilltown 2009 Pinot Noir (California)

description: This 100% Sangiovese leaves a lot to be desired. It's vegetal, with sweet and sour raspberry and vanilla flavors.
title: Toccata 2009 Rosato RosâˆšÂ© (Santa Barbara County)

description: Sweet and simple, this soft wine has sugary berry and cola flavors.
title: Arrow Creek 2010 Sweet Red Coastal Series Red (California)

description: Heavy and globular on the nose, then mulchy, salinic and disjointed for the rest of the ride. Awkward and lemony feeling, with herbal berry flavors, tartness and just not much Pinot pizzazz. A jumbled wine that does not shine.
title: MorandâˆšÂ© 2008 Ediciâˆšâ‰¥n Limitada Pinot Noir (Casablanca Valley)

description: Sweet, soft and vegetal, with asparagus and pineapple jam flavors.
title: Kenwood 2010 Vintage White (California)

description: Nasty in ammonia and bell pepper aromas and flavors. Hardly any fruit at all, maybe a touch of acidic grapefruits and lemons. Yet it's dry and drinkable.
title: Esser 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey)

description: Nutty and sweaty smelling. There's life and acidity to the palate, but the flavors of pickled fruits turn bitter and seem less than clean. Doesn't start that well and never improves.
title: TerraNoble 2010 Reserva Chardonnay (Casablanca Valley)

description: Pretty hard to like. It's harsh in acidity, with watered-down raspberry jam flavors that finish sweet.
title: Jenica Peak 2010 Coastal Series Merlot (California)

description: Not all that clean or clear up front, with aromas of sweated onion and field greens. The palate is fairly sharp and tangy, with pickled flavors of sour apple and lemon. Citrusy on the finish.
title: William Cole 2010 Albamar Chardonnay (Casablanca Valley)

description: With only 9% alcohol, this white Zin has some residual sugar, which makes it off-dry. It's thin in raspberry fruit.
title: Barefoot NV White Zinfandel (California)

description: Herbal and leathery smelling, with a grassy quality to the bouquet. Feels choppy and tannic, with jumbled, stewy flavors that turn more herbal and hot on the finish. Entirely underwhelming.
title: Anakena 2009 Single Vineyard CarmenâˆšÂ®re (Peumo)

description: Sharp and simple, with a great big burst of fruit and a hot, Porty mouthfeel. A rustic blend of several varieties.
title: Adastra 2008 Ed's Red Red (California)

description: The texture is wrong on this five-year-old wine. It's all jagged tannins and sharp acidity, while the blackberry fruit contains suggestions of overripe prunes. Drink up.
title: Hopper Creek 2006 Vallerga Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Yountville)

description: A big bottle of uber-sweet strawberry pie and blackberries right before they get mushy. The aromas are not terribly inviting from the outset. Fairly neutral in taste, then veers sweet.
title: Glen Ellen 2009 Proprietor's Reserve Old Vine Zinfandel (California)

description: This old-vine Zin tastes of tar and overripe fruit and is blandly sweet.
title: Sharabella Wines 2009 Artistica Zinfandel (Lodi)

description: Like the label says, it's sweet as a dessert pastry. It's also simple, with thin flavors of sugared oranges and vanilla.
title: Arrow Creek 2010 Coastal Series Sweet White (California)

description: Rustic and thin, showing green mint and stemmy flavors. Even at this price, it's no bargain.
title: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2010 Pinot Noir (California)

description: A pruny, overripe Merlot that feels harsh and bitter in tannins. Not offering much.
title: Hopper Creek 2007 Estate Merlot (Napa Valley)

description: The nose on this isn't very expressive but eventually reveals notes of red berry, baking spice and a whiff of grilled herb. The palate is raw and tannic, offering unripe sour cherry, young sage and ground pepper but it lacks fruit richness. Bracing tannins dry out the mouth.
title: Rivella Silvia 2012  Barbaresco

description: This offers aromas and flavors of raw red berry, toast, coffee, powdered sage and oak extract. Raspy tannins give it a drying, astringent finish.
title: Ressia 2010 Canova Riserva  (Barbaresco)

description: This wine is a blend of about equal parts Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot, with a balance of Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot. The nose is toast and oak driven, bringing notes of charred currant and dark-roast coffee. Medium bodied on the palate, structured tannins offer support to flavors of racy red and black currant, red plum skin and toasted vanilla.
title: Rappahannock Cellars 2012 Meritage (Virginia)

description: Dark, smoky, herbal aromas come with cheesy notes of oak and horse hide. This has a wiry, high-acid mouthfeel and herbal, spicy, pinched dark-berry flavors. High acidity creates a racy sensation on an oaky, fast-paced finish.
title: Finca Sophenia 2014 Altosur Cabernet Sauvignon (Tupungato)

description: Masterfully puckering tannins greet the palate, challenging the taster to discern the hidden waves of blueberry, vanilla and black licorice behind the wall. Full-bodied, it needs plenty of time and air before enjoying.
title: Eagle Eye 2011 Estate AlphaWOLF Ranch Petit Verdot (Napa Valley)

description: Fragrant and soft, this has a touch of spice that adds interest to the fresh lemon and bright apple fruitiness. With a gentle texture, it is ready to drink.
title: Doudet Naudin 2013  Saint-VâˆšÂ©ran

description: Crisp and tight, this offers bright acidity over a lightly smoky flavor. A green fruit and herb element adds to the general freshness of the wine. Drink now.
title: Domaine Paquet et Fils 2013  MâˆšÂ¢con ChaintrâˆšÂ©

description: The plateau vineyards that are the source of this wine give a cool, crisp and light character. It's fragrant, pure fruitiness, with a light minerality and citrus at the end. Drink now.
title: Domaine Laroche 2014  Petit Chablis

description: The local Bical grape gives this wine a delicious and refreshing character. It offers lemon, crisp pear and green plum flavors, all laced by a mineral texture. It is ready to drink, although it will be better from 2016.
designation: Quinta do Encontro Q do E
title: DâˆšÂ£o Sul 2014 Quinta do Encontro Q do E Bical (Bairrada)

description: This opens with funky aromas of stewed prune, sawdust, sage and a hint of barnyard that carry through to the palate. Astringent tannins give it a gritty, drying finish.
title: Cascina Bruciata 2010 Rio Sordo Riserva  (Barbaresco)

description: Coming from the north-eastern Beiras region, close to the Douro, this wine is a ripe, rich and crisp wine. It has a perfumed character from the Malvasia in the blend and an attractive yeasty aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Casca Wines 2010 Altitude Reserva Bruto Sparkling (TâˆšÂ°vora-Varosa)

description: This wood-aged wine has a ripe fruitiness about it. The tannins give some structure while not taking away from the generous blackberry fruits. It's rich and warm, just hinting at pepper on the finish. Drink now.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2013 Lab Reserva Red (Lisboa)

description: Here is a friendly, fruity, medium-bodied wine with light apple and pear aromas. Off-dry flavors are more melony and floral, and the wine has a relatively soft texture. Made from old vines and fermented in stainless steel, it offers subtle charms.
title: Dutton-Goldfield 2014 Chileno Valley Vineyards Riesling (Marin County)

description: Soft and creamy, this wine has a line of acidity that gives it great lift. Lime and ripe apples go with green plums to give both freshness and a tangy character. It's a wine to age a few months; drink from 2016.
title: Domaine Perraud 2013  Saint-VâˆšÂ©ran

description: This wine comes from the original, own-rooted, 1965 plantings. It would be interesting to trace the ancestry of these vines, as such things were far less understood 50 years ago. Soft, round and fruity, this offers pleasant flavors of melon and apple. A dash of vanilla cookie coming through as it finishes.
title: David Hill 2014 Estate Pinot Blanc (Willamette Valley)

description: This opens with aromas of toasted oak, coffee, ripe berry, sage and a whiff of citrus zest. On the palate, white pepper and coconut back up the core of dried cherry alongside astringent tannins, but it lacks fruit richness.
title: Dante Rivetti 2010 Bricco di Neive Riserva  (Barbaresco)

description: Off dry and fruity, this simple wine tastes like peach juice, with a bit of citrus. It's pleasant but one-dimensional.
title: Cuckoo's Nest 2014 Aromatique Viognier-GewâˆšÂºrztraminer (Oregon)

description: Named after the impressive 10-mile long Vasco da Gama bridge that spans the Tagus estuary, this wine is soft, rounded and fruity. It has delicious, ready-to-drink flavors of ripe cherries and juicy plums. The fruit is sustained by the dry tannins and fresh acidity. Drink now.
title: Cooperativa Agricola de Santo Isidro de Pegoes 2014 10 Mile Bridge CastelâˆšÂ£o (Penâˆšâ‰ nsula de Setâˆšâˆ«bal)
winery: Cooperativa Agricola de Santo Isidro de Pegoes

description: Ripe and juicy, this wine comes mainly from vines in the MâˆšÂ¢con region. Attractive yellow fruit flavors are filled out with spice and almond, accented by refreshing acidity. Drink now.
title: ChâˆšÂ¢teau de Pizay 2014  Bourgogne

description: This is a soft, bold and rounded wine. Rich black currant and berry fruits dominate the blend of mainly Portuguese grapes, with a touch of Syrah. The wine is balanced, ripe and full in the mouth. Drink now.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2013 Bona Vita Red (Lisboa)

description: Damp forest and dried cherry with cranberry combine on the nose and palate in this wine, sourced predominantly from Monterey County. Soft and silky it risks veering off balance once the oak begins to unwrap, becoming quite burly on the finish.
title: Ghost Pines 2013 Winemaker's Blend Pinot Noir (Sonoma County-Monterey County)

description: This has an unusually deep color and a smoky rim. Aromas resemble chocolate and balsamic, while flavors are rich, smoky and savory. The texture is thick with tannins that leave a drying impression on the finish.
title: Boeger 2013 Cabernet Franc (El Dorado)

description: Intensely crisp with a strong lemon and orange zest character, this is a ripe, tight wine with hints of honey and a steely, mineral aftertaste. It will be better from the end of 2015.
title: Bailly-Lapierre 2014  Saint-Bris

description: Still purple-tinged and tasting younger than its vintage would suggest, this is tart with intense beet-root character. The cranberry fruit hides behind earth and stem, while remaining primary and simple.
title: Youngberg Hill Vineyards 2013 Natasha Pinot Noir (McMinnville)

description: Jet black and showing blackberry and cassis at its core, this single-vineyard Syrah spent 18 months in American oak. The barrel regimen dominates the scents and flavors, yielding a dark and chewy wine with rock 'n' roll tannins.
title: Weisinger 2012 Cedar Ridge Vineyard Syrah (Rogue Valley)

description: Slightly earthy, herbaceous tones lend contrast to this juicy, plush Dornfelder that's chock full of black plum and blueberry flavors. Bright and cheery, it's a forward, fruity wine with just a touch of sweetness. Drink now.
title: Villa Wolf 2013 Dornfelder (Pfalz)

description: Stalky aromas of hay and straw lack fruit character. This feels creamy but also acidic, while flavors of vanilla, Bartlett pear and melon end with a sweet note of caramel.
region_1: Alto Valle del Râˆšâ‰ o Negro
title: Verum 2014 Chardonnay (Alto Valle del Râˆšâ‰ o Negro)

description: Buttercup, apple and pear aromas are fragrant and floral. The palate on this Chardonnay is chunky and pulpy, while flavors of pineapple, melon, citrus and mango finish with subdued honey notes.
title: Tucumen 2013 Chardonnay (Mendoza)

description: Blackberry-patch aromas mingle with gardenia and fresh thyme on the nose. The palate is tart, with slightly sharp acids streamlined against bramble berry and pepper.
title: Sutcliffe 2012 Syrah (Colorado)

description: Dominated by Tinta Roriz, this smooth, red fruited wine is ripe on the palate. Tannins come from wood aging as much as the ripe strawberry and red currant fruits. It has a smoky finish that is laced with acidity.
title: Quinta da Casaboa 2012 Tinta Boa Red (Lisboa)

description: Malbec is likely to become a signature red for âˆšâ€ Maurice, as for a number of other young Walla Walla wineries. This excellent bottle proves the point. It's fragrant and deep in color, with verve, tangy blackberry and currant fruit, polished slightly grainy tannins and a seductive, mouth-coating finish. Just the right touch of earth, herb and licorice to give it added interest through the finish.
title: âˆšâ€ Maurice 2006 Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This high-acid, intense wine is beautifully aromatic, with piercing and tart flavors of cranberry and raspberry, pure and laced with minerality. Terrific penetration, the persistence of wet stone, citrus, raspberry and cranberry flavors is impressive.
title: Maison Bleue 2008 Boushey Vineyard Le Midi Grenache (Yakima Valley)

description: Lalayee, says winemaker Virginie Bourgue, means lullaby in Persian. This 51/49 Cab/Merlot blend is textural and pretty, a palate-coating potpourri of cranberry, pomegranate, blue plum and cassis fruit. Bourgue has layered in new barrel nuances of coffee and caramel lattâˆšÂ©, with a whiff of smoke.
title: Lullaby 2007 Lalayee Red Red (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: One of the best value-priced, big and rich wines you're likely to find. The nose impresses with potent blackberry, cedar and marzipan aromas, and the palate bridges the gap between power and elegance. Tastes great, with herbal black cherry and cola leading the way. Very ripe but really well made.
title: Lapostolle 2008 Casa CarmenâˆšÂ®re (Rapel Valley)

description: Shows the voluminous fruit and full body that Laetitia Pinots typically possess, with huge, mouthfilling flavors of cherries, raspberries, red currants, cola and sandalwood. Also pretty tannic. But the notable feature is tart acidity. Not a big problem, but the palate feels it like a bee sting. Best nowâ€šÃ„Ã¬2013.
title: Laetitia 2007 La Coupelle Pinot Noir (Arroyo Grande Valley)

description: A well-constructed wine whose tannic structure and ripeness indicate a pedigreed terroir. In fact, the grapes are from Mount Veeder. Flavorwise, it's all about cherries, ripe from the tree and baked into a pie. It's more light-hearted and silkier than Cabernet Sauvignon, but no less serious.
title: Kent Rasmussen 2007 Esoterica Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)

description: This rich, spicy Zinfandel defines the Dry Creek style. It's fruit-forward in briary, brambly berry and currant flavors that have hints of anise and chocolate, and is dry, with sturdy tannins and a balancing cut of acidity. Very enticing. Only 150 cases were produced, but it's worth a search.
title: Joseph Jewell 2007 Grist Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

description: Lots of crisp, citrusy acidity in this wine, which brightens the pineapple, orange, lemon and lime flavors. Meanwhile, 100% new oak adds a rich coating of smoky, buttered toast. The wine is dramatic, rather than subtle, and is at its best now.
title: Iron Horse 2008 Rued Clone Chardonnay (Green Valley)

description: Rich and ripe, with enormous blackberry, currant, chocolate and cedar flavors, wrapped into firm but smoothly complex tannins. A very good Cab that will develop nuances over the next 4â€šÃ„Ã¬6 years.
title: Hunnicutt 2006 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: This is 100% varietal, this winery's most popular varietal offering, and nicely distinguished from its other reds. Recently bottled, it was still slightly shocked when tasted. Dark fruits, most especially cassis, are woven together with smoke (no mirrors!) and bitter chocolate. Chewy, earthy tannins hold the finish and complement the wine's natural peppery spice.
title: Tamarack Cellars 2007 Cabernet Franc (Wahluke Slope)

description: A seductive nose, densely loaded with black currants and smoke, leads into a textural, single-vineyard, 100% Cabernet with great varietal presence and definition. It needs to breathe open, which puts on more flesh, and starts to unpack the layers. Streaks of mineral, iron, graphite and more cassis roll into the finish.
title: Seven Hills 2007 Seven Hills Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: The grape's floral component plays against its dense and inky tannins, making this a complete and relatively soft version of pure Petit Verdot. It fills in the usual midpalate hole with juicy fruit and softened tannins. It glidesâ€šÃ„Ã®not a word usually found with this as a varietalâ€šÃ„Ã®into a silky, fruity, sweetly floral finish.
title: Seven Hills 2007 McClellan Estate Vineyard Petit Verdot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: Very dry, crisp and minerally, with subtle citrus fruit and floral flavors, this Chardonnay suggests Chablis as its model. The elegant structure is likeable. If you're a fan of big fruit, it's not for you, but it's quite a classy Chardonnay. Good with cracked crab with drawn butter and buttered sourdough bread.
title: Roessler 2008 Big Bend Estate Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Rich and modern, with dense extraction and raw notes of cherry, blackberry and spice, this wine is very representative of the new face of Barbera d'Alba. There are sweet fruit notes followed by equally sweet oak tones of cinnamon, chocolate and spice.
title: Rivetto 2007 Lirano Soprano  (Barbera d'Alba)

description: This is a strikingly pure expression of single-vineyard, Red Mountain Cabernet Sauvignon. Focused and tight, it is extremely dense and textural, with a mix of cassis and coffee. Some of the minerality of the neighboring Ciel du Cheval vineyard is just beginning to show in the fruit from these young vines as well.
title: Quilceda Creek 2007 Galitzine Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Mountain)

description: The 2006 Chertsey is a blend of 49% Cabernet Sauvignon, 47% Merlot, 4% Cabernet Franc and 100% French oak. The oak's vanilla and cedar notes provide a foundation for the wine's cassis and plum flavors, cosseting them in soft tannins. Drink nowâ€šÃ„Ã¬2018.
title: Penley Estate 2006 Chertsey Red (Coonawarra)

description: A very fine Pinot Noir that shows deep, impressively ripe flavors of raspberry and cherry tart, red currant, licorice and Asian spices, with a rich coating of smoky oak. It's entirely dry, and has a brisk scour of acidity. Seems best now and for the next few years.
title: Twomey 2008 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: The Walla Walla Syrah from Trust Cellars is enhanced with 11% Cabernet Sauvignon from the Lewis vineyard, and coopered in 22% new French oak. There is lovely fruit here, with sweet grape, cherry and plum, followed by streaks of chocolate and caramel.
title: Trust 2007 Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: Eradus continues a successful run with this year's Sauvignon Blanc. As usual, it's fairly pungent and herbal upfront, but then delivers waves of passion fruit. It's concentrated and fairly full-bodied for a Sauvignon, with a lingering finish.
title: Eradus 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: A fresh rosâˆšÂ©, so crisp, bright and lively. This is real pleasure, the red berry fruits bursting out of the glass, lifted by delicious acidity. Very crisp, pure in taste.
title: Domaine Saint-AndrâˆšÂ© de FiguiâˆšÂ®re 2009 Vieilles Vignes RosâˆšÂ© (CâˆšÂ¥tes de Provence)

description: This is still a little hard and tight, but shows great ripe red berry fruit and well-balanced tannins. Another Arbor Crest wine with a fine, fragrant bouquet, clean and bursting with fresh fruit scents. It was barrel aged for 20 months in 40% new oak, adding some strength to the tannins and hints of toast to the finish.
title: Arbor Crest 2007 Four Vineyards Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Here's a plump and chewy expression of Barbera with thick fruit notes followed by dense extraction and power. The wine is plush, ripe and velvety and there are soft flavors of fruit and spice on the long finish.
title: Araldica 2006 D'Annona  (Barbera d'Asti Superiore)

description: Starts out foxy and mossy, with leather, char, earth and herbal notes. The palate is nothing if not saturated and big, and the flavors run toward baked, meaty black fruits. Quite roasted and rich, with toasty oak on the finish and darkness throughout. Not the best AltaâˆšÃ˜r but still a fine Chilean red blend.
title: AltaâˆšÃ˜r 2006 AltaâˆšÃ˜r Red (Cachapoal Valley)

description: Here's a very pleasurable Barbera with loads of fruit intensity followed by smoke, pipe tobacco, sweet chocolate and vanilla bean. The wine is executed in a modern style with enduring intensity and a soft, velvety finish. Pair it with baked châˆšÂ®vre cheese.
title: Tenute Cisa Asinari dei Marchesi di Gresy 2006 Monte Colombo  (Barbera d'Asti)
winery: Tenute Cisa Asinari dei Marchesi di Gresy

description: The blend includes old vine (1972 planting) Cabernet from Sagemoor, along with some Klipsun fruit and Seven Hills Merlot. This shows solid winemaking, excellent varietal character, and the structure to age gracefully. The tight cassis fruit is delineated with details of tarragon, rosemary and thyme.
title: Tempus Cellars 2007 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This captivating wine treads the line between RhâˆšÂ¥ne and Bordeaux. A splash of Cabernet, though just a fraction of the blend, stands out. The wine has depth and persistence, and the mix of grapes works well, showing brambly red fruits, like a Zin, spice and pepper, like Syrah, and some herbal and leafy tobacco in the finish. Complex, unique and quite appealing.
title: Sinclair Estate Vineyards 2007 Vixen Red Wine Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Penetrating aromatically, spicy and complex, this brings in sharp berry scents, baking chocolate and a streak of herb. It's tight and vertically structured, and once in the mouth it turns a bit hard and unyielding. But it lingers and resonates, improves after being open for several hours, and can be cellared for up to a decade.
title: Seven Hills 2008 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Still young, steely and firm, but classy and deep. This has the best attributes of the '05 and '06 Columbia Valley Cabs from Seven Hillsâ€šÃ„Ã®ripe and polished black fruits, firm tannins, a supple finish with a veneer of smoke and licorice. In other words, this is a complete, complex and intriguing Bordeaux blend, with plenty of aging potential.
title: Seven Hills 2007 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This is a heavy, dull Petite Sirah. It tastes like the raspberry filling from a candy bar you buy at 7-Eleven.
title: San Marcos Creek 2008 Estate Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)

description: There aren't that many organic Proseccos out there, and this expression from La Jara is thin, crisp and refreshing. There is a pungent grassy note at the outset that needs a few minutes to disappear.
title: La Jara NV Brut  (Prosecco)

description: Sweaty and feral smelling, with just a tad of the pleasant lychee and melon this grape is known for. Feels heavy and oily, with barely any acidity and pithy, oily, citrus flavors. Clunky stuff for new TorrontâˆšÂ©s.
title: Familia Cassone 2011 La Florencia TorrontâˆšÂ©s (LujâˆšÂ°n de Cuyo)

description: Sweet and simple, like pineapple, orange and mango fruit juice from the supermarket.
title: Grandmaster 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Knights Valley)

description: As sweet as a dessert wine, with sugary raspberry, cherry and spice flavors.
title: Forest Glen 2009 White Merlot (California)

description: Barely ripe, with a pungent, ammonia edge to the citrus fruits. It's very dry and crisp in acidity.
title: SeaGlass 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Barbara County)

description: Thin and uninteresting, with vague cherry, berry and spice flavors that taste a little sweet. Gets the basic Zinfandel job done.
title: Rock Wall 2009 Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

description: A simple, dull wine, from a producer that has struggled with Chardonnay for years. Tastes soft and sweet, with some vegetal notes.
title: Oakville Ranch 2009 Chardonnay (Oakville)

description: Hot, rubbery and burning on the nose, and then clampy in the mouth, with compact, highly generic flavors of red cherry and plum. The heat and burn that's present up front re-emerges on the finish, where jackhammer tannins hold court.
title: Caligiore 2010 Staccato Malbec-Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)

description: Off-dry Vouvray, with hints of honey, light on acidity and feeling soft. The wine needs to be drunk over the next year.
title: Bougrier 2010 Doulce France V  (Vouvray)

description: The wine tastes young, with unbalanced acidity and a hard tannin and spirit edge.
title: Barros NV Special Reserve  (Port)

description: As sweet as a dessert wine, with simple pineapple jam flavors.
title: Surf Point 2010 Chardonnay (California)

description: A dry, thin, modest Cabernet, the kind you drink in a paper cup at big parties. The host serves it, and you drink with the food.
title: Surf Point 2010 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: A rustic, simple wine, with ripe, sweet cherry and cola flavors. Feels rough and sharp in the mouth, but not bad for the price.
title: Round Hill 2010 Merlot (California)

description: Very lightweight wine, with some attenuated fruit and a dry character. The attraction is the fresh acidity that does offer some compensation for the overoaked flavor.
title: Louis Chevallier 2009  Bourgogne

description: Rubbery on the nose, with licorice, horse hide and black fruit aromas. Almost too lush and soft in the mouth, with a candied nature and ultrasweet, syrupy flavors of vanilla and baked berries. Finishes with brown sugar and chocolate cake flavors. Extremely sweet; spineless.
title: Bodega Elena de Mendoza 2010 Red Blend Red (Mendoza)

description: Gritty and harsh, with tart acidity framing flavors of sour cherry candy and cola.
title: 24 Knots 2009 Pinot Noir (California)

description: Rates about the same as the winery's reserve bottling due to grassy, green aromas of prickly raspberry. Big, chunky and sort of awkward on the palate, with herbal, rooty flavors. Burns on the finish with heat and spice.
title: Zorzal 2009 Pinot Noir (Tupungato)

description: So sweet in fruit, it's almost like a dessert pastry. Shows blackberry, cherry and cocoa flavors, with pie spices and caramelized oak. Finishes a little sweet, but it's clean and made in a popular style.
title: Rancho Sisquoc 2009 Flood Family Vineyards Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Barbara County)

description: Pink in color, this has fresh, clean aromas of stone fruits. Feels medium to full, with red licorice, sweet baking-spice and raspberry flavors. Quick, round and solid on the finish, which lingers for quite some time. A fine summer sipper.
title: MarquâˆšÂ©s de CâˆšÂ°ceres 2011 RosâˆšÂ© (Rioja)

description: This shows that apricotty, botrytised aroma and flavor often found in Santa Lucia Chardonnays from the cooler parts of the appellation, but it's not at all sweet. Instead, it's a bone-dry wine, with vibrant acidity.
title: Lucia 2010 Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Marked by brisk, cutting acidity, this Chardonnay is bone dry, with a steely, stony cut of mineral that's relieved by lemon and lime flavors. It's a severe wine by itself, but it should be food friendly.
title: Liquid Farm 2010 White Hill Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: A little on the sweet side, but crisp acidity provides a clean whisk of tartness, and the lemon-cream and orange flavors are absolutely delicious.
title: Ferrari-Carano 2011 FumâˆšÂ© Blanc (Sonoma County)

description: This is a ripe Sauvignon Blanc, with herb, yellow fruit and grapefruit aromas. Let this attractive, fruity wine age for another year. Screwcap.
title: Gunter Triebaumer 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Burgenland)

description: A wine bearing flavors of dark cherry and earth, with bright and silky tannins, and a dusting of cocoa on the finish. This may now be in its prime; drink now.
title: Ferriere Vineyards 2003 Raven Oaks VIneyards Cabernet Franc (Sierra Foothills)

description: Lightly floral and quite Burgundian aromatically, this wine exudes a mixture of caramel and earth amid a full-bodied texture and racy acidity.
title: Fenestra 2010 Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)

description: A forward and fruity wine, with red apple flesh, melon and tropical fruit aromas and flavors that are laced with just a hint of oak. The medium-weight mouth is juicy and clean, and the finish brisk and refreshing.
title: False Bay 2010 Chenin Blanc (Western Cape)

description: This young, grapy wine has buoyant flavors of raspberry jam. It needs more time, but the fruit is excellent; the finish just a little warm.
title: Eight Bells 2009 Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Mountain)

description: Very perfumed, this is a spicy Traminer with an amount of sweetness. The wine is ripe and rounded, with dominant tropical fruit. The acidity cuts through the richness. Screwcap.
title: DâˆšÂºrnberg 2011 Altes Kreuz Traminer (Niederâˆšâˆ‚sterreich)

description: For a reserve wine, this seems rather light. Peppery red fruit fills out a broad midpalate, with streaks of bark, smoke and espresso adding interest. It's well balanced, with plenty of acidity.
title: Two Mountain 2008 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

description: Despite the reserve designation, this is a forward, fruity, quaffable red blend of Merlot, Cabernet, Syrah and Cabernet Franc. There's plenty of toast and spice up front, along with somewhat chalky, chocolatey tannins. The finish fades quickly.
title: Revelry 2008 Reserve Blend Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Like many of the Perrin & Fils wines, this one is firmly structured, its cherry and cocoa flavors ending on a dusty, tannic note. But the fruit is attractive, and even boasts some complexity in the wisps of garrigue on the nose. Probably best from 2013â€šÃ„Ã¬2017.
title: Perrin & Fils 2009 Red (CâˆšÂ¥tes du RhâˆšÂ¥ne Villages)

description: Strawberry and other red-fruit aromas run the bouquet. The palate is tangy and crisp, with dry but clean red-fruit flavors. Mildly spiced on the finish, this has length and purity. A very good quaffer.
title: Ochoa 2011 Rosado Garnacha RosâˆšÂ© (Navarra)

description: Stone fruit, fragrant white rose, natural rubber and tangerine blossom mark the nose of this pretty effort. The wine's texture is thick and oily, and there's a touch of sweet spice on the close.
title: Niedermayr Josef 2010 GewâˆšÂºrztraminer (Alto Adige)

description: Concentrated and sweet, with aromas of raisin and cassis that lead onto an intense, syrupy palate, with salty berry, brown sugar and fudge flavors. This is deep as a country well, with a ton of flavor. But truth be told, it's tannic as can be, with a crushing mouthfeel that makes food mandatory.
title: Marques de GriâˆšÂ±on 2005 Single Vineyard Estate Bottled Cabernet Sauvignon (Dominio de Valdepusa)

description: CuvâˆšÂ©e V, MAN's homage to the wines of Vouvray, is an attractive and semisweet-style Chenin Blanc that offers rich aromas of peach, lightly baked apple and tropical fruit. A slight prickle from the bright acidity dances on the palate and keeps the wine from feeling too sweet or heavy. Drink now.
title: MAN Vintners 2011 CuvâˆšÂ©e V Chenin Blanc (Coastal Region)

description: This 100% Sauvignon Blanc is forward in citrus, floral, spice and honey flavors, brightened with crisp acidity. A little heavy and full bodied, this has a touch of green gooseberry that makes it exotic and New Zealand style.
title: Lail 2010 Blueprint Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

description: This has a bright pink color and unique aromas of wild berry and forest floor, with delicate menthol overtones. A blend of Pinot Noir, Lagrein, Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot, it's mouthfeel is more structured and firm than standard rosâˆšÂ©. Pair this with white meat or salted cod.
title: Kellerei Kaltern Caldaro 2010 SignâˆšÂ© RosâˆšÂ© (Vigneti delle Dolomiti)

description: Creamy and rich on the palate, this has flavors of white peach and exotic fruit. There's a subtle touch of sweetness on the close.
title: Kellerei Kaltern Caldaro 2010 GewâˆšÂºrztraminer (Alto Adige)

description: Lavish vanilla and cedar nearly take over this wine, leaving just enough dark, plummy fruit to peek through, yet the wine remains true to its varietal roots in its silky mouthfeel. A bitter coffee note sneaks in on the finish. Seems ready to drink.
title: Josef Chromy 2006 Zdar Pinot Noir (Tasmania)

description: This is an unoaked Chardonnay, with a fresh and lively bouquet of white flower, stone fruit and lemon zest. The cool-climate Alto Adige growing conditions help develop the purity and intensity of the grape's aromas.
title: Colterenzio 2010 Altkirch Chardonnay (Alto Adige)

description: Leathery, earthy aromas don't seem entirely fresh, but they are solid and don't waiver. Full bodied, with coarse tannins and roasted red-berry, tomato and herb flavors. It's tight, chunky and long on the finish, with tannic grab, and more tomato and herb characteristics.
title: Campo Viejo 2004 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

description: This is barrel fermented, with noticeable flavors of heavily buttered toast, butterscotch and caramel flavors. Bright with crisp acidity, it also features notes of ripe pineapple, pear, peach and mango.
title: Aquinas 2010 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Here's a dry, crisp Chardonnay. The tropical fruit flavors are grounded by herbs and minerals, elaborated by smoky oak. Drink now.
title: Cosentino 2010 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: This is ripe and soft, with its red fruits well integrated into the rounded texture. There is a crisp edge to the wine, with spice, lemon and apple skin flavors.
title: ChâˆšÂ¢teau Sainte Roseline 2011 CuvâˆšÂ©e Lampe de MâˆšÂ©duse RosâˆšÂ© (CâˆšÂ¥tes de Provence)

description: Rich in spice, peach, tangerine and honeysuckle flavors, this GewâˆšÂºrztraminer finishes a little sweet. This is a savory wine for drinking nowâ€šÃ„Ã®especially with Asian fare.
title: Castello di Amorosa 2010 GewâˆšÂºrztraminer (Mendocino County)

description: Aromas of radiator dust, melon, apple cider and minerals are intriguing and suggest good quality. A minerally, citric, chiseled palate offers flavors of crushed vitamins, tart persimmon and salty sea brine. Saltiness comes back on a minerally finish.
title: Loma Larga 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

description: Tightly wound in black fruit and integrated tannin, this is a medium-bodied wine with interwoven oak that retains a healthy amount of acidity. Black fruit dominates along with a thickness of violets and meat. Made in tiny amounts from a small producer, it showcases a good vineyard site for the variety.
title: Lois Rae 2013 Las Madres Vineyard Syrah (Carneros)

description: The mini-trend to making white Pinot Noir is taking off in Oregon, and the wines get better with each new vintage. There's not a trace of color here, but plenty of flavor, headed with chunky apple and white peach fruit. Overall fruit-forward describes this best, with some of the flesh of a good stainless Chardonnay.
title: Left Coast Cellars 2015 White Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Bold flavors and plenty of creamy texture make this full-bodied wine seem big and mouth-filling. It offers nice lemon and butter aromas, ripe pear and spicy nutmeg flavors along with a smoky overtone that lasts from the aroma to the finish.
title: Lava Cap 2014 Reserve Estate Bottled Chardonnay (El Dorado)

description: The tart fruitfulness of ripe, red apples rises from the glass. Chock-full of appetizing apple notes, this brings more flavor than your average Pinot Blanc. Drink soon while aromas abound.
title: La Cave des Vignerons de Pfaffenheim 2014 Pfaff Tradition Pinot Blanc (Alsace)
winery: La Cave des Vignerons de Pfaffenheim

description: Soft, gentle and generous cherry notes color the nose and light palate. This is pliable and has pleasant edges of peppery, tingling spice and freshness.
title: Kuentz-Bas 2013 Trois Chateaux Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: More assertive and full-bodied than many versions, this wine smells like snap peas and spring flowers, but gets richer on the palate as peach flavors come out and mingle nicely in the unusually rich texture.
title: Rock Wall 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

description: This well-crafted wine is reflective of the vintage, which brought its share of challenges. Tea-leaf flavors run throughout, along with quite light red fruits and plenty of acid. The finish is on the green side, but not so much that it's detrimental. Drink this wine while cellaring the bigger wines from riper years.
title: Raptor Ridge 2013 Estate Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: Co-fermented with a small amount of Viognier, this wine opens in a flurry of sunflower before unleashing bold, firm flavors and layers of dense tannin and concentrated blackberry and cherry. The tannin continues to expand on the finish.
title: Pride Mountain 2013 Syrah (Sonoma County)

description: Whispers of smoke, toast and nut mingle amidst ripe blackerries and bramble in this full-bodied St. Laurent. It's softly structured, framed by feather-light tannins and a juiciness that's attractive for drinking now.
title: PflâˆšÂºger 2014 Friedelsheimer Trocken St. Laurent (Pfalz)

description: Waxy lemon rind and blossom notes accent this off-dry Riesling full of ripe, almost preserved peach flavor. Briskly textured and fresh in acidity, it's an uncomplicated, drinkable wine. Enjoy now through 2019.
title: Moselland 2014 Arsvitis Riesling (Mosel)

description: This late release is an unusual blend of Syrah, Baco Noir, Tempranillo and Dolcetto. All are strengths of the AVA, though rarely blended together. The extra bottle age has smoothed the rough edges, yielding a pleasant-drinking wine with flavors of strawberry preserves, citrus peel, and a touch of malt powder.
title: Melrose 2010 Equinox Red (Umpqua Valley)

description: This is a bright focused wine with a taut sense of balance, and flavors that are both rich and tangy. Cranberry aromas meet dark chocolate flavors on a tightrope of good acidity and tannins.
title: Enotria 2012 Dolcetto (Mendocino)

description: Fresh green-pear notes appear everywhere and round out the slender palate. Lemon and lime freshness provide extra structure. Drink soon.
title: FranâˆšÃŸois Baur 2015 Herrenweg Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

description: Very ripe and fruity in character, this wine smells like cherries, raisins and spiced plums, and has a grippy texture from good acidity and moderate tannins for a little bite of astringency.
title: Foursight 2013 Charles Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: Bright black cherry animates the aromas and flavors of this medium-bodied wine. It is firm in texture, not too complicated or overripe, but just nice and easy to drink.
title: Fields Family 2013 Estate Grown Syrah (Lodi)

description: This is an appealing, dry, and well-balanced wine, with everything in good proportions. It has lots of fresh cherry aromas, good and deep fruit flavors and a light but tasty layer of toasted, smoky oak.
title: Fetzer 2014 Eagle Peak Merlot (California)

description: A real evocation of fresh, crisp and crunchy apple delivers freshness and punch on the easy-drinking but fresh, clean and joyful palate. Drink this soon, if possible at a summer party where this slender wine will come into its refreshing own.
title: Famille Hauller 2015 Riesling (Alsace)

description: This red blend from Moldova is composed of 70% Feteasca Neagra and 30% Cabernet Sauvignon. It has scents of black pepper, black plum juice and a whiff of jalapeâˆšÂ±o. In the mouth there are flavors of dried plum, cinnamon, clove and persistent sweet tannins in the finish.
title: Et Cetera 2013 Serendipity Red (Moldova)

description: Young and fresh, Elk Cove's entry-level Willamette Valley Pinot is a well-made, fruit-forward expression of the grape. Hints of clove wrap around peppery berry and cherry fruit. It's a bright, appealing wine, drinking quite nicely already.
title: Elk Cove 2014 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Aromatic red berries signal tart pleasure: redcurrant and raspberry. The very easy and smooth body fully plays into that with light-bodied charm. Drink while the aromas still sing.
title: Domaine Saint-RâˆšÂ©my 2014 Rosenberg Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: A subdued nose of crushed oak leaf whispers with the slightest hint of red berry. The palate is oak-spiced and gentle: think tart red plum with cinnamon. This is fresh and light bodied for a red, but has ample charm.
title: Domaine RieflâˆšÂ©-Landmann 2014 Bonheur Convivial Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: This perfumed, fruit-forward wine is ripe with red berries and sweet tannins. The aftertaste brings in the freshness of the year.
title: Domaine Jean Fournier 2014 Trois Terres  (Marsannay)

description: Full and soft, this wine is a rounded style of rosâˆšÂ©. Ripe strawberry flavors are cut with crisper raspberries. The wine, produced at the Pessac-LâˆšÂ©ognan estate of Domaine de Chevalier, has attractive, refreshing acidity to complete a harmonious package. Drink now.
title: Domaine de Chevalier 2015 RosâˆšÂ© de Chevalier RosâˆšÂ© (Bordeaux RosâˆšÂ©)

description: Intense aromas of white flower, honeydew melon and tomato vine lead the nose while the bright, juicy palate offers pink grapefruit, kiwi and unripe peach. A briny note closes finish.
title: CVA CanicattâˆšÂ¨ 2015 Fileno Grillo (Sicilia)

description: Made with 70% Inzolia and 30% Chardonnay, this opens with scents of white flower, Mediterranean herb and a hint of orchard fruit. The linear palate offers lime and yellow apple accompanied by bright acidity.
title: Cusumano 2015 AngimbâˆšÂ© White (Sicilia)

description: Peach and apple aromas are soft and easy, maybe even a touch cidery. Overall, this is a standard but well-made AlbariâˆšÂ±o, with flavors of nectarine and cider. Drink immediately.
title: Condes de Albarei 2015 AlbariâˆšÂ±o (Râˆšâ‰ as Baixas)

description: This pretty light pink wine's acidic bounty is apparent on first sniff, as the underripe raspberry aromas are cut by a baking soda-like freshness. The sip of this mostly Grenache-based pinkie is all about the sizzle, where more club soda zest is painted with a light bubblegum flavor.
title: Jamie Slone Wines 2015 RosâˆšÂ© (Santa Barbara County)

description: Coming from one of the region's more picturesque vineyards, this bottling, which is enhanced with 19% Picpoul Blanc, 2% Roussanne and 2% Viognier, leans a tad tropical on the nose, with orange peel cutting into banana, apple custard and tuberose. There's sizzling acidity throughout the palate, with flavors of lemon curd, apple peel and grapefruit pith.
title: Halter Ranch 2014 Grenache Blanc (Adelaida District)

description: The addition of southern Oregon fruit to the Plowbuster amps up the candy-cherry flavors in a good way. It's forward and fruity, with additional details of citrus fruits, notably fresh oranges. Give it a little breathing time and it fills out nicely.
title: Carabella 2013 Plowbuster Pinot Noir (Oregon)

description: Earthy, lightly baked cassis and raspberry aromas come with a dose of oaky vanilla. A full, bright, healthy palate delivers baked berry and cocoa flavors in front of a solid finish with molasses, vanilla and raspberry notes. Drink this mature Rioja now.
title: Covila 2007 II Reserva  (Rioja)

description: Dusty aromas of melon and apple smell a bit leesy. This feels round and complete, while melon, citrus and apple flavors turn more briny on the finish, where a saline quality takes over. Overall, this is bright and right. Drink now.
title: Finca Arantei 2014 Single Vineyard Estate Bottled AlbariâˆšÂ±o (Râˆšâ‰ as Baixas)

description: Made with Sangiovese and 5% Merlot, this opens with scents underbrush, scorched earth, cedar and baked plum. The palate offers dried black cherry, ground pepper, licorice and a confectionary note supported by assertive, fine-grained tannins. A grilled herb note signals the close.
title: Fattoria di Montemaggio 2009 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

description: Although this is a delicate wine in terms of aroma and flavor, it has a vividly tart texture that's especially refreshing. It smells subdued, resembling cucumber and white pepper, then the flavors add white peach and crisp apple notes. This will make a great match with raw oysters, sushi and other appetizers.
title: Dancing Coyote 2013 Estate GrâˆšÂºner Veltliner (Clarksburg)

description: A blend of Shaw and Boushey vineyards, this 100% varietal wine displays aromas of bittersweet chocolate, savory herbs, an earthy funk, sawdust and woodspice. It's supple in feel, with sweet cherry and chocolate flavors that linger.
title: Damsel 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Straightforward apple and lime flavors are simple and stony. Lemony acidity gives the palate snap and purpose, while flavors of kiwi, orange, lime and lemon finish tangy, with length and vitality. Drink now.
title: Condes de Albarei 2014 AlbariâˆšÂ±o (Râˆšâ‰ as Baixas)

description: This is a rich, densely tannic wine with dark-hued blackberry fruits and ripe acidity. It is concentrated, still very firm while just beginning to show its full-bodied character. Wait until 2018.
title: ChâˆšÂ¢teau la Tour de By 2011  MâˆšÂ©doc

description: This is a big, bold and fruity wine, packed with ripe Merlot fruit. Juicy blackberry flavors have a fine shot of acidity and soft tannins. It's a warm wine that will age well over the medium-term. Drink from 2018.
title: ChâˆšÂ¢teau la Patache 2012  Pomerol

description: This 100% varietal wine comes from Mirage, Klipsun, Seven Hills and Force Majeure vineyards. The oak (50% new French) takes the lead with aromas of vanilla, coffee and cinnamon in front of plum and berry. Flavors are reserved, showing a mixture of fruit and barrel that continues through the finish.
title: Browne Family Vineyards 2012 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: An enterprising blend of Cabernet Franc, Merlot, Malbec and Syrah, this zippy, light-footed rosâˆšÂ© is full of tart cranberry and sour cherry acidity. Crisp yellow peach notes add sunshine on the palate. It finishes crisp and clean.
title: Bedell 2014 Taste RosâˆšÂ© (North Fork of Long Island)

description: Violets and lavender perfume lend lift to this plush, velveteen Cabernet Franc. Ripe black cherry and berry flavors are rich and concentrated, off set by crisp cranberry acidity and soft, lingering tannins.
title: Bedell 2013 Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

description: This classically crafted, 100% Sangiovese offers varietal aromas of forest floor, freshly turned soil, dark berry and a whiff of violet. The firm palate offers dried black cherry, ground pepper and aniseed alongside assertive tannins. It's still rather closed and needs a couple more years to open up. Drink 2017â€šÃ„Ã¬2022.
title: Antico Colle 2012  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano

description: Made with Sangiovese and Canaiolo Nero, this charming wine opens with fruity aromas of wild red berry and a whiff of dried herb. The bright, easygoing palate offers juicy wild cherry, crushed raspberry and clove alongside lithe tannins. It's made for pure drinking pleasure so enjoy soon.
title: Agricoltori del Chianti Geografico 2013  Chianti Colli Senesi

description: Aromas of sweet barrel spices, dried flowers, herbs and dark fruit lead to tart cherry flavors and a cranberry-filled finish.
title: 3 Horse Ranch Vineyards 2011 Barrel Select Reserve Merlot (Washington)

description: This nicely balanced wine was made partly in barrels and partly in stainless steel. It smells like vanilla, cream and chamomile, and tastes as crisp and juicy as fresh-cut apples. Layers of flavor unfold with each successive sip, resembling nutmeg, pear and fig. The texture stays smooth and rich but with lively acidity underneath.
title: Parducci 2013 Small Lot Blend Chardonnay (Mendocino County)

description: Underbrush, ripe plum and baking spice aromas waft out of the glass. On the palate, vanilla, licorice, dark chocolate and espresso accent the black cherry core while polished tannins provide the framework. Drink through 2017.
title: Panzanello 2013  Chianti Classico

description: Very juicy, easy blueberry-fruited, light Zweigelt made for fun, easy drinking. Unpretentious and honest, this could also be chilled in summer. Wonderful for picnics and other occasions where a joyful but uncomplicated red is needed.
title: Nittnaus Anita und Hans 2013 Zweigelt (Burgenland)

description: A bright pink color and absolutely fresh grapefruit aromas suggest a crisp and lively wine, and that's what this 88% Grenache and 12% Viognier delivers. The flavors are quite dry but vivid, like lemon, tart cherry and ruby grapefruit. The texture is lean, the body is not heavy and the finish is tangy.
title: Midsummer Cellars 2014 Grenache RosâˆšÂ© (Yolo County)

description: Aromas of vanilla and baking spices are out in front of fruit leather, herbs and peppery spices. Flavors are exceptionally sweet and ripe, lingering on the finish. Drink now.
title: McCrea 2010 MourvâˆšÂ®dre (Yakima Valley)

description: Aromas of roasted coffee bean, toast, oak-driven spice, ripe berry and scorched earth lead the nose. The firm palate offers black cherry extract, espresso, licorice, oak and coconut alongside assertive, grippy tannins. Still oak driven and tightly tannic, give this a few years to fully develop but then drink to capture the remaining fruit richness. Drink 2017â€šÃ„Ã¬2021.
title: Mazzei 2011 Castello Fonterutoli Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

description: Beautifully aromatic and ripe pear notes dominate, the palate is light but shows friendly, ample fruit that makes this very appetizing and easy to drink. A perfect, refreshing, easy-drinking summer wine.
title: Martinshof 2014 Friends GrâˆšÂºner Veltliner (Niederâˆšâˆ‚sterreich)

description: Lightly toasted aromas of apple and lime are mellow. This feels fresh and citrusy, with lime, orange and tropical fruit flavors. A steady, sturdy finish comes with a mild salty note of sea brine.
title: Llopart 2011 Brut Reserva Sparkling (Cava)

description: Following a rather neutral nose, the freshness and texture of grapefruit peel fizzes away on the palate. There is concentration, briskness and texture while the finish is lip-smackingly lemony. Drink soon.
title: Leth 2014 Hofweingarten Roter Veltliner (Wagram)

description: Unique aromas of lime blossoms, flowering herbs and a tiny bit of jalapeâˆšÂ±o combine for a fascinating nose on this winery's entry-level offering. There is a slightly bell pepper element on the palate, but it's quite tasty alongside the ripe pears and other familiar flavors.
title: Testarossa 2013 Cuvee 107 Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Fragrant, fresh, young and zippy, this is a simple, fruity summer rosâˆšÂ©. The nose expresses only citrus but the mild palate shows some of the cherry-ish roundness of Zweigelt. Its light body and full fruit make it the ideal light refreshment. Drink as soon as possible.
title: Winzer Krems 2014 Zweigelt RosâˆšÂ© (Niederâˆšâˆ‚sterreich)

description: This opens with aromas of small woodland berries, cedar and tilled earth. The chewy palate offers fleshy black cherry, red currant, mocha and baking spice alongside assertive but fine-grained tannins. Drink 2016â€šÃ„Ã¬2020.
title: Viticcio 2012 Beatrice  (Chianti Classico)

description: Without any dosage, this bone-dry wine has shocking initial acidity that then opens up to allow the attractive white fruits and mineral character to shine. It is six years old, but it still tastes young and should be kept until 2017.
title: Vincent Couche 2009 ADN Montgueux  (Champagne)

description: This medium-bodied Sauvignon Blanc adds a bit of creamy depth on the midpalate, while its aromas and flavors of fig and melon are on the ripe side for Marlborough. Despite that, it's still clean and refreshing, with a long, citrus-pith finish.
title: Jules Taylor 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: Fulsome and voluptuous in red and dark cherry, No. 7 is meant to be â€šÃ„Ãºdebonair, charismatic and seductive.â€šÃ„Ã¹ It is all those things, and stays well balanced between fruit, spice and oak, the weight and texture indeed silky and seductive.
title: JCB 2012 No. 7 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: This was aged in equal parts new and used French oak. The new takes the lead with its aromas and flavors of coffee, cocoa and barrel spices out in front of dark fruit. It brings undeniable appeal but the variety seems to get a bit lost.
title: Januik 2012 Weinbau Vineyard Malbec (Wahluke Slope)

description: The apricot and pear flavors are obviously very ripe, but they're balanced by brisk acidity, and a certain stong minerality you often find in Carneros Chardonnays. Oak plays its part. A bit obvious, but for the price, there's plenty of opulence.
title: RouteStock 2009 Route 121 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: This new baby from Crasto is an easygoing wine, full of berry fruits, gentle tannins. It is ready to drink, finishing softly and freshly.
title: Quinta do Crasto 2008 Flor de Crasto Red (Douro)

description: This medium-bodied Barossa blend displays supple tannins and a silky finish, making it immediately accessible. Hints of smoke and sweat and complexity to the currant aromas and flavors.
title: Peter Lehmann 2007 Clancy's - Shiraz - Cabernet Sauvignon - Merlot Red (Barossa)

description: A good red wine that does just what Merlot is supposed to do, be enjoyable now. It's softly fruity and immediately likeable, with pleasant cherry pie, blackberry, cocoa and sandalwood flavors.
title: Peter Franus 2007 Merlot (Napa Valley)

description: Bright aromas of Granny Smith apple, green fruit, melon and honey emerge from the nose of this fragrant expression of Pinot Grigio. It is creamy and textured in the mouth with a touch of smooth almond paste on the close.
title: Niedermayr Josef 2009 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: The question is how much oak can you handle? If you like a heavily toasted, resiny type of full-bodied Chardonnay, add two or three points. If you absolutely hate that style, then subtract a few points. For those of us in between, look for resiny, toasty, heavy aromas on top of a thick, chewy palate full of baked apple and tons of wood spice. One-dimensional but well made.
title: Monteviejo 2008 Lindaflor Chardonnay (Mendoza)

description: Broad, ripe style, concentrated while retaining lightness of touch. There is a good mineral element balancing the yellow fruits and rich texture.
title: Wine & Soul 2009 Pintas Guru Branco White (Douro)

description: New oak gives a vanilla cream and buttered toast accent to this pretty wine, but the basic fruit flavors also are nice, offering varietal waves of pineapples, pears and green apples. It's a super-drinkable Chardonnay whose richness suggests elaborate fare, like shellfish.
title: La Crema 2008 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Delicious freshness here, with crisp fruits, citrus and apple and a touch of caramel. Very fresh, great acidity, hints of mineral and flint.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2008 Domaine Drouhin-Vaudon RâˆšÂ©serve de Vaudon  (Chablis)

description: This wine resembles Zinfandel, although it's drier and smoother in the mouth, with a silky texture. Nonetheless, it has robust flavors of wild, dried dark fruits and berries, sprinkled with cocoa and black pepper. It's a nice wine to drink now with everything from roast ham to grilled chicken.
title: C.G. di Arie 2007 Block #4 Primitivo (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

description: Soft and ripe, a wine that is wide open. With its light and crisp character and attractive yellow fruits, this will develop quickly.
title: Bouchard PâˆšÂ®re & Fils 2008 Beaune du ChâˆšÂ¢teau Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: A heavy, roasted, charred nose gives this a dark outlook, and the bulky but smooth palate of black fruits and baked flavors does little to lessen the load. Feels good on the finish, although it tastes rather normal and a touch bitter. Round and fairly rich Malbec.
title: Bodega Norton 2007 Privada Malbec (Mendoza)

description: Flowery lime, kiwi and mountain stream aromas reflect the wine's clean personality. The mouthfeel is fresh and lightly wavy, with lychee, kiwi, lime and green apple flavors. Clear throughout, with good balance and weight to the finish. Very nice for a tangy, zesty, lean sort of white.
title: Bodega Merced del Estero 2009 Mil Vientos TorrontâˆšÂ©s (San Juan)

description: This is a nice, easy-drinking Merlot, but it also has enough complexity to pair with a good cut of meat. It's dry and shows stylishly fine tannins that frame rich flavors of blackberries, cherries, licorice and cola.
title: Bell 2006 Merlot (Napa Valley)

description: This is a lovely Sauvignon Blanc that shows enough elegance and finesse to serve with fine food. It's dry and crisp, with citrus, lemongrass, gooseberry and mineral flavors. Nice with tempura appetizers.
title: Azur 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)

description: You really can't beat the purity and liveliness of this luminous Chardonnay. This is a pure expression of the grape in its essence. The nose shows little sign of winery intervention and the mouthfeel is creamy and rich in a very understated, elegant way.
title: Andriano 2009 Somereto Chardonnay (Alto Adige)

description: A tasty Sauvignon Blanc, with crisply acidic grapefruit, pineapple and lime juice flavors, touched with oak. A nice appetizer sipper, with some complexity. Good with asparagus risotto, bruschetta with goat cheese, a nice roast chicken with sautâˆšÂ©ed new potatoes and rosemary.
title: Gary Farrell 2009 Redwood Ranch Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)

description: This is a very successful (from packaging to content) expression of Pinot Grigio from cool-climate northern Italy that offers pretty aromas of honey, peach and citrus. It tastes full and creamy on the close but also delivers refreshing crispness at the end.
title: Erste Neue 2009 Grauer Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: Dark, compact and with good lift. The nose is lively and the palate shows medicinal black cherry and coffee flavors. Juicy enough, with driving but blended acidity pushing a spicy, minty finish. Peppy but nice for Argentine Merlot.
title: Cicchitti 2007 Merlot (Mendoza)

description: This wine has some off aromas, seeming to show some oxygen exposure, which distracts from its notes of orange peel and spice. The palate is considerably better but struggles to make up the difference.
title: Hawkins Cellars 2014 Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: A rustic, 100% varietal wine from Corbett vineyard, Leo is soft and approachable. It's a wine to please a range of palates in its lushness of blueberry and black licorice.
title: Jeff Gordon 2010 Leo Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: This plump, medium-bodied rosâˆšÂ© is a blend of two-thirds Syrah and one-third MourvâˆšÂ®dre. It's a fruit-driven style, driven by hints of peach, cantaloupe and bubble gum, that should have broad appeal.
region_1: Vin de Pays de la MâˆšÂ©diterranâˆšÂ©e
title: Jean-Luc Colombo 2014 Cape Bleue RosâˆšÂ© (Vin de Pays de la MâˆšÂ©diterranâˆšÂ©e)

description: As crisp and light as the mountain air of Savoie, this citrus and apple-bright wine offers great fruitiness and a tangy, orange-zest aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Philippe Viallet 2014 Les Cantates Chignin JacquâˆšÂ®re (Vin de Savoie)

description: This is a clean, refreshing rosâˆšÂ© from the generally higher altitudes of Luberon. In the modern, cold-fermented style, it's a bit confectionary in fruity estersâ€šÃ„Ã®somewhat reminiscent of bubble gum or cotton candyâ€šÃ„Ã®yet dry on the finish.
title: Marrenon 2014 Classique RosâˆšÂ© (Luberon)

description: This simple blend of 50% Sangiovese, 30% Merlot and 20% Cabernet Sauvignon opens with aromas of dried black cherry, vanilla and a whiff of coconut. The round, soft palate shows mature black fruit and coffee alongside ripe tannins. Enjoy soon.
title: Castellani 2013 Monsalaia  (Maremma Toscana)

description: Minerally white-fruit aromas lack specificity. This is fresh but standard in feel, with briny flavors of nectarine, apple, citrus pith and nut skins. A dilute finish is fresh but thin. Why this blend of Sauvignon Blanc, AirâˆšÂ©n and Verdejo costs what it does is beyond comprehension because it smells, tastes and feels generic.
title: Alcardet 2015 Sommelier Sauvignon Blanc-AirâˆšÂ©n-Verdejo White (La Mancha)

description: Subtle green-apple aromas and rich, ripe pear flavors make a pretty convincing argument for this full-bodied but soft-textured wine.
title: Twisted Cedar 2012 Chardonnay (Lodi)

description: Lemon-lime aromas and flavors like meringue and butterscotch pudding turn this wine into a virtual dessert. It's not what many people would expect from this grape variety, but it's very tasty and rich.
title: Chateau CâˆšÂ¥te Nord 2014 Chardonnay (North Coast)

description: This deep-colored wine has a concentrated smell like dried figs and lots of ripe blackberry flavors that glide along on a smooth, nicely dense texture. One gulp easily leads to another one.
title: Bota Box 2013 Shiraz (California)

description: Punchy plum and raspberry aromas are light and fresh, as is the palate, which introduces jumpy acidity to the equation. Like the nose, this tastes of basic red fruits, cherry and plum in particular, while the finish is persistently fruity. This is 54% Tempranillo and 46% Garnacha.
title: Albet I Noya 2014 Petit Albet Red (Catalunya)

description: This brawny wine opens with subdued aromas that recall leafy underbrush, roasted coffee bean and a whiff of stewed plum. The warm, monolithic palate offers prune steeped in spirits, toasted nut, dark spice and a green note of powdered sage alongside raspy tannins that leave an astringent finish. The heat of evident alcohol on the close throws it further off-balance.
title: Fanti 2011  Brunello di Montalcino

description: This light Chablis is fresh and packed with attractive young fruitiness. It comes from the plateau above the Serein valley and shows its provenance in the cool-climate crispness. Drink now.
title: Domaine Louis Moreau 2014  Petit Chablis

description: Light, bright and fresh, this wine is ready to drink. Crisp apple and lemon flavors are lifted by tangy acidity. Juicy and very fruity it has a perfumed aftertaste.
title: Domaine Daniel Reverdy et Fils 2014  Sancerre

description: Red cherry meets with tar, wet herbs and cinnamon stick on the nose of this wine. Framed by a decent tannic structure, the palate boasts flavors of more red cherry and thyme.
title: Danza del Sol 2011 Sangiovese (California)

description: The Sauvignon (64%) comes from Bacchus with the SâˆšÂ©millon from neighboring Dionysus. After starting out slightly reduced, fig and spice aromas lead to tart, lemon and tropical fruit flavors that need more cohesion and concentration to keep them together.
title: Cloudlift Cellars 2014 Updraft White (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: A pretty pale salmon color is matched by aromas of strawberry and herbs that are light and delicate. The palate brings the suggestion of sugar with an elegant styling.
title: Cloudlift Cellars 2014 Lucy RosâˆšÂ© of Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

description: Though shy on the nose, this popular bottling delivers intrigue on the palate. Light red-cherry flavors are bolstered by pepper spice and a chalky tannic grip. Even for geeky connoisseurs, it's a good bottle for later in the night.
title: Castle Rock 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

description: A nose of strawberry and mint with a whiff of petrol sets the scene for flavors of cassis, cherry preserves, peach and eucalyptus that never quite coalesce. Soft tannins drop off immediately after a burst of white peach at the finish.
title: âˆšÃ¡amlibaÆ’Ã¼ 2012 Kuntra (Turkey)

description: This is round, ripe and full of rich fruitiness. It has a tannic structure that gives the wine concentration and a tight texture. The fruit is less obvious making this much more a rosâˆšÂ© for food. Drink now.
