description: A finely balanced wine, with acidity, a soft texture, new wood and flavors of cocoa and smoke. There is beautiful red cherry fruit, laced with spice and buried tannins for aging. Keep this impressive wine for 6-7 years.
title: Domaine Bertagna 2008 Clos Saint-Denis  (Clos Saint-Denis)

description: Bright and dense, totally packed with dark fruits and aromas, this young and brambly blend brings tart, wild berry, cassis and smoky espresso into play full force. There's black licorice also, coffee grounds, and powerful tannins, along with the acids to age.
title: Den Hoed 2006 Marie's View Red (Horse Heaven Hills)

description: This beautifully bold and opulent Barolo opens with dark extraction and super-soft aromas of melted milk chocolate, red cherry, vanilla cream, cinnamon and dark spice. The mouthfeel is rich and soft with sweet cherry flavors on the close.
title: Cascina Ballarin 2007 Bussia  (Barolo)

description: This Priorat-like blend of 50% Grenache, 28% Syrah, and 22% MourvâˆšÂ®dre is pungent and spicy, with a bit of menthol in the nose. Supple and luxurious fruit, a mix of raspberry and black fruits, baking spices, sweet barrel flavors. Powerful and rich, this is a big wine with tobacco and clove highlights and a little heat in the finish.
title: Gramercy 2009 The Third Man Red Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Giacomo Vico presents a beautiful Barolo with gorgeous intensity and extremely elegant lines that characterize both the bouquet and mouthfeel. Aromas of cola, cherry, soya, tobacco and cedar are followed by firm, drying tannins.
title: Giacomo Vico 2006  Barolo

description: Big, rich, thick, showing all the hallmarks of a wine that means business. Very great from a Petite Sirah point of view, massively constructed in blackberries, cherries, blueberries, anise, coffee, cocoa and spices, with firm, rich tannins, and the briary, slightly rustic mouthfeel that characterizes the variety. Really good now, with decanting, and should develop in the bottle for many years.
title: Envy 2008 Nord Vineyard Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)

description: An absolutely gorgeous Cabernet. It flatters all the way through, from the flamboyantly ripe cassis, cherry, cocoa and anise flavors to the smooth tannins and long, spicy finish. So refined and rich, yet so elegant. Should age for at least the next 6â€šÃ„Ã¬8 years.
title: Silverado 2008 SOLO Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)

description: Bright melon and lime zest aromas lead to lightly sweet, broad, fleshy fruit flavors in this wine. It's not entirely representative of the variety but still brings a lot of freshness and appeal.
title: Kestrel 2016 Falcon Series Viognier (Yakima Valley)

description: Woodbridge makes two styles of Chardonnay, and this is the richer one. Attractive layering of fruit, cream and hazelnut flavors on a nicely viscous texture makes this full-bodied wine something special. It has a good sense of concentration and depth, along with a lingering finish.
title: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2016 Chardonnay (California)

description: This blend of 57% Syrah, 40% Grenache and 3% MourvâˆšÂ®dre brings grilled asparagus, stewed fruit and black olive aromas. It's plush and palate-coating, but the aromas and flavors are out of sync.
title: W.T. Vintners 2014 Stoney Vine Vineyard Red (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: The ripeness of Mercurey in this vintage is very apparent in this rich, smooth and soft wine. Juicy red fruits dominate, backed by a core of tannins and the spice from wood aging. It is a wine with a good medium-term future. Drink from 2019.
title: Vignerons de Buxy 2016 Buissonnier  (Mercurey)

description: Fruity and juicy, this wine is open and full of black-cherry flavors. The structure of Morgon waits behind the fruit, giving a dry core. This is a wine for medium-term aging. Drink from 2018.
title: Vignerons de Bel Air 2016 Belairissme Le Py  (Morgon)

description: This widely available bottling by the Niven family is a very safe and reliable expression of Cab, with black plums, crushed slate, a touch of oak, some purple flowers and a little soy on the nose. The palate is also down the middle, with earth, wood and dark fruit all present, framed by strong acidity and firm but not overwhelming tannins.
title: True Myth 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

description: This is a light and easy-sipping wine. Floral, apple and lightly herbaceous aromas lead to generous fruit flavors like Pippin apples and white peaches while a good balance of crispness and richness shapes the mouthfeel.
title: Terra d'Oro 2016 Chenin Blanc-Viognier (Clarksburg)

description: Ripe fruit aromas show alongside an equally rich, creamy palate. This wine has attractive lemon and crisp apple flavors, touched by wood to give a smooth, rich aftertaste. Drink from 2018.
title: Sylvaine et Alain Normand 2016  MâˆšÂ¢con La Roche Vineuse

description: Hailing from the volcanic soils of Tenerife in the Canary Islands, this blend of Pedro XimâˆšÂ©nez and ListâˆšÂ°n Blanco opens with aromas of citrus peel and honey. A powerful palate is angular and smacking. Salty citrus flavors reflect an ocean influence, while the wine is strong on the finish.
title: Suertes del MarquâˆšÂ©s 2015 Trenzado White

description: Intensely dark blackberry fruit meets with game and minty chocolate on the nose of this appellation blend by Adam Lee. The flavors are woody with forest undergrowth, and surround a core of mulberry.
title: Siduri 2015 Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: This is a great option for a widely available and affordable rosâˆšÂ©. A very pretty pink in color, it shows baked strawberry, rose petals and vanilla ice cream on the nose. The sip tightens around cherry and strawberry-brioche flavors.
title: SeaGlass 2016 RosâˆšÂ© (Monterey County)

description: A pale pink in the glass, this light and clean bottling shows aromas of chalk, pink flowers, watermelon and a slice of lime. It's crisp on the sip with a tight texture, offering a very quaffable bubblegum flavor.
title: Rabble 2016 Mossfire Ranch RosâˆšÂ© (Paso Robles)

description: Savory pepper and rustic gravel aromas meet with strawberry and dried cherry on the nose of this proprietary red blend that is widely available. Strawberry pie flavors dominate the sip, but there's also a lava rock minerality and a burst of acidity.
title: Rabble 2014 Mossfire Ranch Red (Paso Robles)

description: This clos within a clos has produced a crisp red-fruit and light-tannin-flavored wine. Its red-currant and raspberry fruits are balanced with acidity as well as tannins. The wine has a bright aftertaste. Drink from 2019.
title: Domaine Jessiaume 2015 Clos du Clos Genet  (Santenay)

description: This wine has strong wood aromas that also dominate the palate. Happily, the yellow and citrus fruit behind the wood is ready to shine through. Give this rich wine time to balance out, from late 2018.
title: Domaine des Deux Roches 2015 Pommard Carette  (Saint-VâˆšÂ©ran)

description: This structured wine benefits from the rich fruitiness of the vintage. Based in Morgon, the producer has vines on steep slopes, resulting in structured wines with firm tannins as well as generous fruits. Drink from 2018.
title: Domaine de Leyre-Loup 2015  Morgon

description: Clean aromas of nectarine and white peach meet with a touch of chalk, slight edge of lemon zest, sweet butter and sea salt on the nose of this bottling. There is a decent texture to the sip, where lemon, lime, toasted nuts and more sea-salt flavors show.
title: Crave 2014 Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: This warm, ripe wine is smoothly creamy and ready to drink. Touches of yellow fruits are balanced with just the right amount of acidity. The wine is rich and generous.
title: Clos des Rocs 2015 Les Barres  (Pouilly-LochâˆšÂ©)

description: Saint-Amour is the most northern of the Beaujolais cru villages, close to Pouilly-FuissâˆšÂ©. Its specialty is structured, rich wine like this. It is a ripe wine, full of black fruits and dense tannins. Still young, it is a style of Beaujolais that needs to age. Drink from 2019.
title: ChâˆšÂ¢teau de Lavernette 2015 Le Chatelet  (Saint-Amour)

description: This opens with black-skinned berry, dried violet and star anise aromas. The savory, easy-drinking palate delivers blackberry, black pepper and clove flavors set against bright acidity and supple tannins. Enjoy through 2020.
title: Castello del Poggio 2015  Barbera d'Asti

description: This opens with aromas of red-skinned berry, blue flower and a whiff of clove. The straightforward palate offers tart red currant, orange zest and ground pepper alongside brisk acidity. Drink soon to catch the fruit richness.
title: Cascina Castlet 2016  Barbera d'Asti

description: This opens with rose petal, red-skinned berry and cake spice aromas. It's bright and easy drinking on the palate, with Morello cherry, raspberry jam and cinnamon flavors. Vibrant acidity and smooth tannins lend easygoing support. Enjoy through 2020.
title: Caldera 2015  Barbera d'Asti

description: Ripe berry aromas are heady. In the mouth, this hard-edged Cabernet is gritty and smacking. Ripe plum and blackberry flavors are backed by hefty but pulling tannins, and overall the texture is quite rough.
title: Awning 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Apalta)

description: This is a very fresh medium-bodied wine that overflows with ripe raspberry and blackberry flavors. It's the opposite of a serious age-worthy wine, but wonderful to drink now for its effusive fruit flavors that come along with just enough tannin for support on the palate.
title: AVA Grace Vineyards 2015 Fruity Silky Soft Merlot (California)

description: With wood aging and the rich flavors from lees stirring, this is a ripe wine, gently oxidative as well as full of yellow fruits. It is a broad wine, typical of the vintage, although happily with a crisper citrus aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Arnaud Baillot 2015  Bourgogne

description: It is not clear while a simple appellation Bourgogne should need a wax capsule and heavy bottle. It all makes it that much harder to get to the warm ripe wine inside. With its strawberry fruit that is laced with acidity, the wine is generous, reveling in the fine 2015 vintage. Drink from 2018.
title: Arnaud Baillot 2015  Bourgogne

description: Earthy, lightly grilled plum and berry aromas are a bit damp. Like a gate slamming shut, this is abrupt on a clipped palate. Choppy red-plum, tomato and herbal flavors lead to a gravelly and crisp finish, with astringent tannins.
title: Alta Cima 2013 Special Edition Ensamblaje Gran Reserva Red (LontuâˆšÂ© Valley)

description: This light-bodied wine is quite unusual, as it's a rosâˆšÂ© made from Nebbiolo grapes. It has a pinkish-copper color, peachy aromas and Rainier cherry flavors on a smooth texture. It's not too high in acidity, has a fairly broad mouthfeel and a hint of sweetness.
title: Terra d'Oro 2016 RosâˆšÂ© (Amador County)

description: This wine's raspberry, red apple, spice and red fruit aromas are bright. The flavors are ripe and full bodied, showing some heat.
title: Tempus Cellars 2014 Art den Hoed Vineyards Grenache (Yakima Valley)

description: Oily aromas of orange peel, orange blossom and wild flowers set up a slightly viscous palate. Flavors of pear, lychee and bitter melon barely hold up on a plump finish. Drink this aging Moscatel right away.
title: Telmo Rodrâˆšâ‰ guez 2013 Mountain Blanc Moscatel de Alejandrâˆšâ‰ a (MâˆšÂ°laga)

description: This Riesling has just the right amount of minerality balanced against apple and peach flavors, and an underlying core of lime. Fermented in stainless steel, it is bright and joyful to drink, boasting a long finish. Pour alongside all the classic pairings from Asian takeout to a proper curry.
title: V. Sattui 2012 Riesling (Anderson Valley)

description: This is a rich, smoothly textured wine that has great fruitiness, as well as a fine amount of spice and acidity. The combination makes for a well-balanced wine that's fresh while ripe and concentrated. Drink from 2014. Screwcap.
title: Tegernseerhof 2011 Loibenberg Smaragd GrâˆšÂºner Veltliner (Wachau)

description: Still young and tight, this terroir-driven Chardonnay needs further cellaring to show its best. Woody scents top off crisp, persistent tree fruits, with lemony acids propping up flavors. It's dense, compact and unyielding, but clearly the raw materials for ageworthiness are there.
title: Roco 2012 Rose Rock West Vineyards Chardonnay (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: The 2011 Aurora Vineyard Chardonnay comes across as super rich, without being superripeâ€šÃ„Ã®a neat trick. It's lush and toasty from the moment the cork is pulled, showing mixed tropical-fruit flavors buoyed with moderate acidity. The perfumed nose carries through in the mouth, almost like a GewâˆšÂºrztraminer.
title: Ponzi 2011 Aurora Vineyard Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)

description: Notes of honeycomb and sugar cookie add a caramelized warmth to ripe tangerine and peach aromas on this aromatic Riesling sparkler. It's intensely floral and fruity on the palate, but with hints of maturity and a laser-sharp acidity that cuts through rich, foamy mousse.
title: Peter Lauer NV Brut Riesling (Mosel)

description: Fragrant and delicately fruity, this is a lively, bright wine. It shows elegance, apple acidity and a stylish structure of zesty lemon and orange. It's delicious to drink now, but also keep a few bottles until 2019. Screwcap.
title: Forstreiter 2012 Kremser Kogl Bergwein Reserve GrâˆšÂºner Veltliner (Kremstal)

description: This Mazuelo (Carignan) is strongly perfumed, with whiffs of juniper, funk and blueberry along the way. A full, lively, deep palate is home to black-fruit, chocolate and vanilla flavors, while the finish surfs on the edge of syrupy and fully ripe, ultimately falling on the right side of the fence.
title: Dinastâˆšâ‰ a Vivanco 2010 Colecciâˆšâ‰¥n Vivanco Parcelas de  (Rioja)

description: A terrific value, this 50-50 blend displays gentle oaking and a hint of warm asphalt, just enough to highlight the wine's plum and black cherry fruit. It's full bodied and features a long finish, outlined by wonderfully fine, dusty tannins. Drink nowâ€šÃ„Ã¬2018.
title: D'Arenberg 2010 d'Arry's Original Shiraz-Grenache (McLaren Vale)

description: More toasty than fruity at this stage, this is a finely made wine with vanilla flavors that dominate the ripe tropical fruits underneath. Give it a year and the wine will balance out richly and smoothly.
title: ChâˆšÂ¢teau Tour de Mirambeau 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Citrus and herb characteristics show strongly in this full-bodied wine. They are enhanced by light wood flavors that smooth out the acidity. The result is a full, rich wine that could age. Drink from 2015.
title: ChâˆšÂ¢teau Maison Noble 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Soft and fruity, this is a wine that already shows attractive, ripe fruitiness. Black currants and a mineral texture add bite, allowing the tannins to fill out the core. This is a wine for medium-term aging.
title: ChâˆšÂ¢teau Lynch-Moussas 2011  Pauillac

description: Made in a supple, immediately approachable style, this is a nicely supple, slightly creamy, almost gulpable red. Raspberry and cherry fruit is buttressed by ample spice, then ends on a lingering note of star anise. Drink nowâ€šÃ„Ã¬2018.
title: Turkey Flat 2010 Grenache (Barossa Valley)

description: A terrific value, this blend of 60% Grenache, 20% Mataro and 20% Shiraz features a forward bouquet of slightly jammy mixed berries. The palate showcases vibrant red fruit on a supple bed of tannins, capped off by a savory, tapanade-laden finish that makes it more than a simple fruit bomb. Very silky and drinkable, it's the ultimate wine-bar wine, as the name suggests.
title: Torbreck 2010 CuvâˆšÂ©e Juveniles Red (Barossa Valley)

description: A terrific value, the 2012 Mount Crawford offer sup a big hit of lime on the nose, but also intriguing brine and talc notes that add extra dimension and complexity. It's a medium-bodied wine with ample texture and a long, layered finish. It may not age as long as some other Eden Valley Rieslings, but it's delicious now, so why wait?
title: Thorn Clarke 2012 Mount Crawford Single Vineyard Riesling (Eden Valley)

description: A mature, mossy (in a good way) Shiraz, this seamlessly blends cedar and vanilla shadings with dark berry notes. It's medium to full in body, with solidly savory and earthy underpinnings that make it especially easy to match with food. Drink nowâ€šÃ„Ã¬2018.
title: Peter Lehmann 2008 8 Songs Shiraz (Barossa)

description: A structured wine, rich in both tannins and fruit, this wine gives a solid performance. Its black and red berry fruits are already balanced with the tannins, while the acidity lends a delicious lift. Delicious now, but best to wait until 2015.
title: ChâˆšÂ¢teau Tertre de BelvâˆšÂ®s 2011  Castillon CâˆšÂ¥tes de Bordeaux

description: With fine acidity and firm tannins, this is a solidly structured, rich and ripe wine. It is full, fruity and has a smooth texture that already offers pleasure. On the finish there is delicious juicy fruit.
title: ChâˆšÂ¢teau Rauzan-Gassies 2011  Margaux

description: This is a lively, juicy wine. It shows the fruitiness of the vintage balanced with a sense of structure. There is a freshness to this wine that gives it great lift and makes it likely to be drinkable soon. Drink from 2016.
title: ChâˆšÂ¢teau Grand-Puy Ducasse 2011  Pauillac

description: Rich and structured, yet full and concentrated, this wine has both dark tannins and ripe plum and berry fruits. The acidity streaks through the wine, lending freshness and good aging potential. Drink from 2017.
title: ChâˆšÂ¢teau de Belcier 2011  Castillon CâˆšÂ¥tes de Bordeaux

description: When a producer renowned for its red wines can turn out an elegant, understated white of this quality, you know Australian Chardonnay has firmly arrived. Subtle accents of toasted nuts frame citrusy fruit, and while the wine is full-bodied and round in the mouth, it remains focused and long and on the finish. If you're fortunate enough to get some of the 600 bottles imported, drink the wine over the next couple of years.
title: Wolf Blass 2010 White Label Chardonnay (Adelaide Hills)

description: The Wohlmuth family has owned this vineyard since 1803, producing wines with impressive continuity. The Sauvignon Blanc is rich, and almost tropical, but without being heavy. Apples, pears and apricots combine beautifully. It could age for a year or two, but is thoroughly drinkable now.
title: Wohlmuth 2012 Hochsteinriegl Sauvignon Blanc (SâˆšÂºdsteiermark)

description: This is a ripe, smooth wine that has fine acidity and some intense peppery flavors. From the Wachtberg vineyard, it shows great mineral character as well as a dense texture that brings out rich fruits. Age this for another year.
title: Winzer Krems 2012 Kremser Wachtberg Reserve GrâˆšÂºner Veltliner (Kremstal)

description: So refreshing and fruity, this is so drinkable now. It's bright with crisp white fruits, floral perfume and lively acidity. There is also a more serious, structured side which suggests it could age so drink a few now, but save a few bottles to enjoy through 2019. Glass stopper
title: Weszeli 2012 Loiserberg Riesling (Kamptal)

description: This is one full-bodied, hefty wine. The nose is toasty, minty and a touch herbal. In the mouth, solid tannins support what would otherwise be a syrupy, soft Cabernet. Flavors of baked blackberry and cassis finish with brown-sugar sweetness and length. This is a wine for folks who like their Cabs rich and plush.
title: ViâˆšÂ±a Cobos 2011 Bramare Cabernet Sauvignon (LujâˆšÂ°n de Cuyo)

description: Fresh lemon and gooseberry flavors lend an herbaceous edge to this fruity but tightly textured wine. It has richness and density, but it's a wine that is both refreshing and serious. Keep for a year before drinking.
title: ChâˆšÂ¢teau Argadens 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

description: A smooth and rich wine, this has weight and concentration. At the same time, it has an attractive, light-hearted feel that's poised and elegant. The wine could age for a few years. Screwcap.
title: Pratsch 2010 RotenpâˆšÂºllen GrâˆšÂºner Veltliner (Niederâˆšâˆ‚sterreich)

description: Made in the modern style of oaky creaminess and very flashy fruit, this Chardonnay erupts in a burst of oranges and rum punch, buttered toast and honey. It's rich and layered, if a little soft.
title: Porter Family Vineyards 2009 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Aromatic and refreshing, with scents of white blossoms, stonefruits and a hint of beeswax, this is fermented entirely in stainless steel and meant to be enjoyed fresh and young. Squeaky clean on the palate with hints of white peach, underripe pineapple, lime pith and a bright, lemony acidity that tickles the palate.
title: Paumanok 2011 Festival Chardonnay (North Fork of Long Island)

description: Give this dynamic young Cabernet blend a good decanting or a little time in the cellar to mellow and let its edges round off. It's tannins are hard and astringent, masking the blackberries and black currants. Not one for the long haul, but 3â€šÃ„Ã¬4 years should do the trick.
title: Matanzas Creek 2009 Journey Red (Sonoma County)

description: This is a perfumed wine, with intense flavors of spring blossom, grapefruit and white peach. It has a tight line of acidity that cuts through to the finish. Screwcap.
title: Markus Huber 2011 Terrassen Riesling (Traisental)

description: An eccentric Chardonnay, although it's well made and has intellectual appeal. Bone dry and acidic, this has intense flavors of apricots, pineapples and honey. It should age for up to 8 years, gradually losing fruit and gaining earthy, minerally qualities.
title: Lucia 2010 Soberanes Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: This is a good value in the plush superripe style of Cabernet that seems to be popular these days. The velvety mouthfeel easily carries bold vanilla and plum flavors over the palate, partly balanced by a savory-spicy element. Drink now.
title: West Cape Howe 2008 Book Ends Cabernet Sauvignon (Great Southern)

description: Delicately perfumed, this has ripe, intense aromas of apricot and pear. It is round and concentrated, with a full texture and minerality. Screwcap.
title: Eichinger 2011 Hasel GrâˆšÂºner Veltliner (Kamptal)

description: Medium bodied and firmly structured, this doesn't show the generosity of the 2009 vintage as much as some other Nothern RhâˆšÂ¥nes. Instead, it's a traditionally built wine with classic notes of smoke, herbs and black olives, and even some ash-like notes on the finish. Drink 2013â€šÃ„Ã¬2018.
title: Domaine Les Hauts de Mercurol 2009  Crozes-Hermitage

description: The cherry, leather and chocolate aromas are accompanied by a slightly citrusy aroma in this blend of 65% Grenache, 20% Syrah, 10% Carignan and 5% Cinsault. It's creamy, warm and inviting on the palate, with black cherry and plum fruit, before turning chocolaty on the long finish. Drink now.
title: Domaine de Dionysos 2009 La DevâˆšÂ®ze Red (CâˆšÂ¥tes du RhâˆšÂ¥ne)

description: A blend of 50% Grenache, 40% Syrah and 10% MourvâˆšÂ®dre, this is full bodied and richly textured, redolent of wild thyme and lavender, black cherries and a hint of cocoa. Drink this charmer over the next couple of years.
title: Domaine Charles Thomas 2009 Red (CâˆšÂ¥tes du RhâˆšÂ¥ne)

description: The Baker's Gully Syrah is the entry-level offering from Clarendon Hills, but it remains a very good wine. It's medium to full in weight, with some alcoholic warmth and hints of slightly raisined fruit, yet charms for its velvety-soft tannins and aromas of chocolate and baking spices. Drink now.
title: Clarendon Hills 2008 Baker's Gully Syrah (Clarendon)

description: The wine has a dark, inky appearance, with bold nuances of blackberry, plum and black cherry on the bouquet. This oak-aged effort should pair well with lasagna or grilled sausage and polenta.
title: Abbazia di Novacella 2008 Praepositus Riserva Lagrein (Alto Adige)

description: A rounded style, with full-bodied red fruits and a rich, silky texture. The wine still does have attractive acidity and a crisp grapefruit edge to balance it out.
title: Domaines Ott 2011 ChâˆšÂ¢teau de Selle RosâˆšÂ© (CâˆšÂ¥tes de Provence)

description: This is the lighter of the two rosâˆšÂ©s from Saint-AndrâˆšÂ© de FiguiâˆšÂ®re. It brings out crisp fruit, lively spice and red berry, with a great streak of clean, mouthwatering acidity.
title: Domaine Saint-AndrâˆšÂ© de FiguiâˆšÂ®re 2011 CuvâˆšÂ©e Signature RosâˆšÂ© (CâˆšÂ¥tes de Provence)

description: From one of the Sumeire family estates, this ripe, red-fruited wine is cleanly balanced with the purest fruit flavors. There is just a touch of lemon and exhilarating acidity.
title: ChâˆšÂ¢teau l'Afrique 2011 RosâˆšÂ© (CâˆšÂ¥tes de Provence)

description: Full in the mouth, this is a rich style of rosâˆšÂ©, with delicious red-berry crispness. It is ready for food with its tangy, textured aftertaste. Screwcap.
title: ChâˆšÂ¢teau de Pourcieux 2011 RosâˆšÂ© (CâˆšÂ¥tes de Provence)

description: This is dry and spicy, with a full character. Perfumed and rich, it's concentrated and packed with wild strawberry fruit. It finishes with intense acidity.
title: ChâˆšÂ¢teau Beaulieu 2011 ChâˆšÂ¢teau Beaulieu RosâˆšÂ© (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: This has green apple and creamed pear flavors, with a lively, buoyant texture. It's worth aging for a few more months. Screwcap.
title: Buchegger 2011 Holzgasse GrâˆšÂºner Veltliner (Niederâˆšâˆ‚sterreich)

description: Beautifully pristine on the nose and palate, with concentrated notes of fresh lemon and apple, with hints of waxy white flower and honeycomb. There's significant weight and body on the palate, amplified by notes of sweet cream, smoke and an umami-rich salinity that lingers on the finish. Fermented entirely with ambient yeasts. Drink now.
title: Bedell 2010 Chardonnay (North Fork of Long Island)

description: There's a great freshness to this Chenin, with upfront, juicy notes of clementine, Granny Smith apples and green melon rinds. The light and refreshing palate transitions into a bright, mouthwatering finish, with accents of pineapple-flavored acidity.
title: Beaumont 2011 Chenin Blanc (Walker Bay)

description: This is a mature GrâˆšÂºner that's rich, ripe and deliciously smooth. It has a great depth of flavor, with notes of wild herb and passion fruit that are balanced with mature acidity.
title: Arndorfer 2008 Die Leidenschaft GrâˆšÂºner Veltliner (Niederâˆšâˆ‚sterreich)

description: Two-thirds of the blend is Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc, initially tannic with an emphasis on the greener flavors sometimes found in those grapes. It's well-balanced, elegant and tart, with highlights of cinnamon and chocolate from aging in one-third new French oak barrels.
title: Andrew Will 2009 Two Blondes Vineyard Red (Yakima Valley)

description: This is rounded, with a creamy texture and fruity aromas. It's warm, with pear and baked-apple flavors set over wood spice. Worth aging for a few months. Screwcap.
title: Hâˆšâˆ‚pler 2011 Guttenberg GrâˆšÂºner Veltliner (Burgenland)

description: A big, rich, softly jammy Petite Sirah that's packed with flavors of blackberry, blueberry, dark chocolate, anise and pepper. It's tannic, so cellaring this puppy for a good six years is recommendedâ€šÃ„Ã®although, it will always be fairly rustic.
title: Frank Family 2009 SJ Vineyard Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)

description: This is rich and oaky, with ripe orange, pineapple and pear flavors and the buttered toast of oak barrel aging. Almost too much of a good thing, it trades nuance for sheer power, but it's certainly a good example of the California style.
title: Fort Ross 2010 Bicentennial Commemorative Bottling Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: This is a full-bodied wine that has plenty of weight and richness. It has spice as well as ripe red fruits; its balanced with delicious acidity and a dart of orange peel.
title: Domaine d'Eole 2011 RosâˆšÂ© (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: The second rosâˆšÂ© from Vignelaure is a delicate, fruity wine, with attractive acidity to go with its orange and white fruit flavors. The finish is smooth, with just a tang of lemon zest.
title: ChâˆšÂ¢teau Vignelaure 2011 La Source RosâˆšÂ© (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: Ripe, smooth and toasty, this has the feel and texture of Chardonnay. It is full and rounded, yet its acidity and red fruit character lend elegance.
title: ChâˆšÂ¢teau d'Esclans 2010 Les Clans RosâˆšÂ© (CâˆšÂ¥tes de Provence)

description: A rustic, tannic Zin, with sweet flavors of red berries, oranges and pepper that finish with a scour of acidity.
title: Zina Hyde Cunningham 2006 Zinfandel (Mendocino)

description: A hint of honeysuckle and orange blossom graces the red apple and juicy melon fruit flavors. Tangy and a touch astringent in the mouth with a finish of bitter citrus pith.
title: Rooiberg 2011 Chenin Blanc (Robertson)

description: Typical orange, lychee and pineapple aromas set it off in the right direction. In the mouth, however, it's angular and lean, with hard, narrow flavors of tart citrus and lychee. Bites on the finish, which is oily in texture.
title: Nâ‰ˆÃ§made 2010 TorrontâˆšÂ©s (Cafayate)

description: Not much fruit shows up on the bouquet but there is a bland sense of vanilla and cookies. Feels heavy but with adequate citric acidity. Tastes monotone and lemony.
title: Casa de Campo 2011 TorrontâˆšÂ©s (Mendoza)

description: A wine that is dominated by the perfumed Colombard, leaving the more herbaceous Sauvignon Blanc to one side. It is soft with just a light lemon zest edge. Screwcap.
title: Haut Marin 2010 Colombard-Sauvignon Blanc (CâˆšÂ¥tes de Gascogne)

description: Trebbiano, Roscetto and Malvasia are blended to produce a clean and simple wine with sharp, clean lines backed by lively aromas of citrus, pear and Golden Delicious apple.
title: Falesco 2010 White (Est! Est!! Est!!! di Montefiascone)

description: There's an overripe, saturated element to this Trebbiano that is reflected in its deep golden color and its aromas of melon, apricot and honey. The mouthfeel is soft and sticky.
title: Ciavolich Giuseppe 2009 Ancilla  (Trebbiano d'Abruzzo)

description: This is proof that vintage variation is alive and well in Argentina. Reflecting a hot year, this is stewy and heavy. It smells of licorice, mint and black fruit, while the palate is syrupy. Prune, raisin and stewed blackberry flavors are front and center.
title: Benegas 2009 Libertad Vineyards Malbec (Mendoza)

description: Not really pink, more of a salmon color, and quite sweet, with tangerine jelly and vanilla flavors. Good acidity and super-clean winemaking make it balanced and zesty.
title: Barefoot Bubbly NV Pink Moscato Sparkling (California)

description: Seems like we're catching this wine late in its cycle. It's not very expressive on the nose, and even though there's still life to the palate, it's dealing only mild apple and citrus flavors followed by heat and acidic scour on the finish.
title: Argie 2009 Andes TorrontâˆšÂ©s (La Rioja)

description: Basic apple and vanilla bean aromas carry the nose to a plump, round palate with tropical flavors and banana. Feels peachy and tastes yeasty and sweet on the finish. Highly regular as a whole.
title: Zolo 2011 Unoaked Chardonnay (Mendoza)

description: This simple Chardonnay has sweet flavors of buttered popcorn, toast, orange soda and vanilla. It's made in the popular style.
title: Wheelhouse 2010 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: This dry Pinot Noir is a little ungenerous, offering modest sour cherry candy and wintergreen flavors. It's also a little bitter, tasting almost like press wine.
title: Inception 2009 Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)

description: A great value wine to pair with deviled eggs, stuffed mushrooms or fried shrimp. This Orvieto Classico represents a blend of Trebbiano Toscano, Malvasia, Grechetto and Drupeggio and opens with crisp green apple, dried hay and stone fruit.
title: Rocca delle MacâˆšÂ¨e 2010  Orvieto Classico

description: Dilute and watery on the bouquet, with a touch of lime and air freshener. Feels oily and chunky on the palate, with citrus and not too much else to ponder. Lemony and tangy on the finish, with pithy bitterness.
title: Camino del Inca 2011 TorrontâˆšÂ©s (Cafayate)

description: This is a simple, one-dimensional Pinot Grigio that drinks easily and would pair with salads or grilled tuna. The wine is redolent of citrus, green apple and a touch of white almond.
title: Caldora Vini 2010 Pinot Grigio (Terre di Chieti)

description: Gazza Ladra is a chalky, but almost sweet smelling expression of Fiano from southern Italy with aromas of candied lemon and honeysuckle. It's thin and compact with a bright touch of acidity on the close.
title: Santa Lucia 2010 Gazza Ladra Fiano (Puglia)

description: This is not a particularly successful vintage for this estate vineyard bottling. Rough and tannic, it seems more like a Lemberger than a Pinot Noir, and the bitter, herbal finish may or may not smooth out with further bottle age.
title: Redhawk 2009 Pataccoli Family Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: A big, sweet wine, heavy in the mouth, with fabulously ripe blackberry, cherry and chocolate flavors. Bring on the lasagna and cheeseburgers. The blend is Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Petite Sirah.
title: Red Rock 2010 Reserve Winemaker's Red (California)

description: Sweet orange soda, vanilla and buttered popcorn flavors mark this one-dimensional Chardonnay. It's fortunately brightened with crisp acidity.
title: Lucky Star 2010 Chardonnay (California)

description: A pretty standard Pinot Noir, dry, thin and acidic, with pleasant raspberry jam and spice flavors.
title: Lincourt 2009 Lindsay's Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Earthy in aromas, with notes of leafy tomato and red plum. Feels narrow and compact, with herbal, slightly tart flavors of red berry mixed with peppery barrel spice and green herbal tinges. Light, then toasty and spicy on the finish.
title: Lagarde 2010 Merlot (Mendoza)

description: A distinct green streak shines throughout this wine, with aromas of green bean and plantain and flavors of grass and pepper. Light weight but a bit round in the mouth, with a medium-length finish.
title: Helderberg Wijnmakerij 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Stellenbosch)

description: An okay, light- to medium-weight Zinfandel that veers into stewy flavors and aromas before falling a tad flat on the finish.
title: Hannah Nicole Vineyards 2009 Zinfandel (Contra Costa County)

description: Better known in the DâˆšÂ£o for its red wines, the Alfrocheiro grape can obviously make attractive sparkling wines. This Blanc de Noirs is fresh with just a touch of tannin and full of red currant fruit flavors. Drink now, for its freshness and fruit.
title: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima NV RosâˆšÂ© Bruto Alfrocheiro (Tejo)

description: Delicate aromas of pressed spring flower, yellow apple and citrus carry over to the brisk palate along with a mineral note. Vibrant acidity gives it a crisp, tangy finish.
title: Petrucco 2014 Pinot Bianco (Friuli Colli Orientali)

description: Lush and a bit ruddy, this velvety sweet-style Dornfelder bursts of sun-kissed black plums and cherries. It's soft in structure but its fruity, forward demeanor makes for a comforting sip.
title: Peter Mertes 2014 Platinum Sweet Red Dornfelder (Rheinhessen)

description: Almost overripe richness of fleshy peach pervades nose and medium-sweet palate. There is a heady overtone of vanilla into the bargain. For those who like it rich and decadent.
designation: Clos Gaensbroennel Kirchberg de Barr Grand Cru
title: Willm 2011 Clos Gaensbroennel Kirchberg de Barr Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

description: Cut grass, tomato vine and gooseberry aromas lift out of the glass. The thin, brisk palate offers grapefruit and pineapple alongside zesty acidity.
title: Valle 2014 Sauvignon (Friuli Colli Orientali)

description: A crisp, lively texture makes this medium-bodied wine refreshing while light flavors of green apple and kiwi make it tasty. Vibrant acidity gives it freshness and will help it be versatile with food.
title: Geyser Peak 2014 Chardonnay (California)

description: This bright wine has aromas that suggest citrus blossom and tropical fruit. The lively, slender palate shows crunchy Granny Smith apple and pineapple accompanied by brisk acidity.
title: Dorigo 2014 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Colli Orientali)

description: Pretty cherry fruit shows some spicy highlights, along with hints of leather. The funky aromas will be more pleasing to some palates than others. You make the call.
title: Division 2014 Les Petits Fers Gamay Noir (Oregon)

description: At first oaky and tannic, this needs breathing time to show more of its fruit. Red-berry flavors come up slowly, along with lighter notes of herb and stem.
title: Ledger David 2013 Estate Tempranillo (Rogue Valley)

description: White flower, orchard fruit and crushed stone aromas delicately guide the nose. The easygoing palate offers Bartlett pear, apple skin and a hint of mineral alongside bright acidity.
title: La Tunella 2014 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Colli Orientali)

description: Scents of wildflower and apple float out of the glass. The delicate aromas carry over to the light-bodied, linear palate, along with a hint of pear and a mineral accent. Vibrant acidity gives it a clean, fresh finish.
title: Kornell 2014 Eich Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

description: This is a simple, rather generic white wine. The fruit is clean with an impression of light spice around flavors of apple and pear. It's a useful, all-purpose, fruity quaffer.
title: Hanson Vineyards 2014 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

description: A hard, chewy wine, this brings tight flavors of cassis and black olive, plus an herbal edge that veers into bitterness. Chalky acids come up through an attenuated finish.
title: Griffin Creek 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Rogue Valley)

description: This is a red sparkling wine, pure Touriga Nacional but also shockingly acidic and dry. Plus it has tannins. It's well made for what it is and will certainly appeal to drinkers who like red sparkling wine.
title: DâˆšÂ£o Sul NV Encontro Brut Tinto Touriga Nacional (Vinho Espumante de Qualidade)

description: Sweet-leaning aromas of pineapple, ripe red apples and white lilies show on the nose of this bottling. The palate starts with nice texture of Meyer-lemon pith, then settles toward ripe pears and apples, with hints of coconut and pineapple flavors.
title: Cupcake 2014 Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: Subtle aromas of tomato vine, chopped herb and gooseberry set the tone while the lean, direct palate offers white grapefruit, yellow bell pepper a saline note. Bracing acidity gives it a crisp finish.
title: Comelli 2014 Sauvignon (Friuli Colli Orientali)

description: The nose opens with aromas of white spring flower and green Anjou pear. The lively, straightforward palate offers crunchy green apple and lime zest alongside vibrant acidity.
title: Cembra 2014 Classici Pinot Grigio (Trentino)

description: Delicate aromas of orchard fruit and whiff of spring blossom lead the nose on this light, refreshing white. Reflecting the cool, wet vintage, the palate is rather lean but still offers pear, apple and a hint of mineral alongside a backbone of bracing acidity.
title: Cantina Produttori San Michele Appiano 2014 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: With flavors of ripe raspberries along with a tannic structure, this is a wine that shows both freshness and strong minerality. It has tangy orange flavors as well as intense acidity. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Campolargo NV Bruto RosâˆšÂ© Sparkling (Bairrada)

description: This is a fine blend of Malvasia and Bical giving fresh acidity that's rounded and filled out with spice, perfume and a creamy texture. It's already an attractive wineâ€šÃ„Ã®bright and fruity. Drink now.
title: Caminhos Cruzados 2014 Titular Colheita Branco White (DâˆšÂ£o)

description: Rustic smelling at first, this is showing a fair amount of animal and leather on the nose. In the mouth, this is wiry and pointed, with crisp acidity. Angular currant and red plum flavors finish clean and juicy.
title: Bodega Calle 2012 Alberti Malbec (LujâˆšÂ°n de Cuyo)

description: Cherry and cassis aromas are bright and bring an animal note. An energetic palate hosts plum, berry and herbal flavors, while a forward-charging finish is fiery and leaves a palpable herbal aftertaste.
title: Argento 2014 Malbec (Mendoza)

description: Light in color and body, this wine takes its delicacy seriously, holding back on the fruit and spice to feature woody, herbal characteristics and a slim body.
title: Apriori 2014 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: The nose boasts ripe dark cherry and raspberry aromas, with a dash of spice for nuance. Light, smooth and juicy on the palate, cherry and blackberry flavors resound in this easygoing Pinot Noir.
title: 2 Lads 2013 D. CuvâˆšÂ©e Pinot Noir (Old Mission Peninsula)

description: A wine for the faithful, this is tasty and light bodied. It does a nice job of combining fresh, fruity aromas with appealing black-cherry flavors and a moderately tannic, appetizing texture.
title: Monogamy 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)

description: This medium-bodied wine has fresh fruity and lightly spicy aromas, with a lively texture due to reasonable acidity and tannins. Flavors do a good job of balancing raspberry and cherry with slightly oaky vanilla and nutmeg.
title: Middle Sister NV Goodie Two Shoes Pinot Noir (California)

description: Rubbery, briny red-berry aromas come with a horsey accent. This is juicy and a bit raw in feel, with slightly tart red-plum and raspberry flavors. A light note of buttery oak on the finish is cut by lasting acidity.
title: Luberri 2014 Orlegi  (Rioja)

description: The nose is rather shy but eventually reveals delicate scents of spring flower and lime. The vibrant, straightforward palate delivers grapefruit and a hint of tangerine accompanied by brisk acidity.
title: La Vis 2013 Sette Fontane Nosiola (Trentino)

description: Yellow wildflower and peach aromas follow through to the fresh, linear palate along with a nectarine note. It's zesty and balanced, with crisp acidity.
title: Franz Haas 2014 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: White peach, hints of smoke, yellow pear and squeezed lemon show on the rounded nose of this wine. It's softer in style on the palate, with kumquat cream, poached apple and pear, white flowers but also a sharper herbal backbone of dill and fennel.
title: Firestone 2014 Barrel Select Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: With fresh, pure fruit flavors, great balance and very full body, this wine will be great at the table. It has a dry but velvety feel, moderate tannins and good acidity, all of which lift up the great cherry and boysenberry nuances and give an overall impression of freshness.
title: Renwood 2013 Story Vineyard Zinfandel (Amador County)

description: Plump, fleshy black cherry and berry flavors command this ripe, lusciously textured wine. It's unabashedly forward in fruit, but is still an elegant, nuanced wine shaded by lingering tones of spice, crushed rock and smoke. Cranberry acidity extends through a long, persistent finish. Ready to drink now but should improve through 2021.
title: Meyer-NâˆšÂ§kel 2013 S SpâˆšÂ§tburgunder (Ahr)

description: This full-bodied and beautifully flavored wine goes deep in terms of ripe fruit and subtle spices, and has a calm, composed character and ultrasmooth, slightly restrained texture. Delicious black-cherry and currant notes come out in the bouquet, weave through the palate and linger on the finish.
title: Goldeneye 2013 Gowan Creek Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: For a wine with such a dainty footprint, complexity and impact abound here. Ripe, almost tropical melon, mango and citrus flavors are grounded by a savory backdrop of earth, dried leaves and black tea. It's bright and brisk but deeply concentrated through a long finish.
title: Fritz Haag 2014 Brauneberger Juffer Sonnenuhr Auslese Riesling (Mosel)

description: Inviting aromas of blackberry preserve on rye toast, cigar box, split pine, dill and black olive show on this single vineyard expression by Billy Wathen. Lifted by a slowly simmering acidity, the palate is earthy and forest-driven, with mushroom, juniper, pine needle, strawberry and dried mint flavors.
title: Foxen 7200 2013 Vogelzang Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

description: Perfumed with enticing scents of yellow flower, beeswax, orchard fruit and crushed stone, this shows the serious nature of Greco di Tufo. The elegant, mineral-driven palate delivers yellow apple, lemon zest, dried Mediterranean herb and mineral framed in tangy acidity. It's an extremely impressive showing especially given the cool, wet vintage.
title: Feudi di San Gregorio 2014 Studi Laura  (Greco di Tufo)

description: This opens with aromas suggesting pear, yellow stone fruit, Mediterranean herb and a whiff of citrus while the vibrant palate delivers crisp green apple, juicy lime, saline and energizing mineral. Racy acidity provides the backbone. Give this time to fully develop. Drink 2017 through 2024.
title: Feudi di San Gregorio 2014 Studi Bussi  (Greco di Tufo)

description: This is lovely in color, scent and flavor. Elegant and complex, it's perfect for near-term drinking. The strawberry fruit carries some darker highlights, and flavors from aging in 100% French oak bring a lightly charred, toasty frame around the lingering finish.
title: Elizabeth Chambers 2013 Winemaker's CuvâˆšÂ©e Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Peppery lime fruit highlights this single-clone effort. The impressive minerality brings clean flavors of wet rock into play. It's terrifically refreshing, with the crisp acidity to age nicely over the next six to eight years.
title: Durant 2014 Raven Chardonnay (Dundee Hills)

description: This is a bold, ripe wine, full of both tannins and rich black fruits. Spice from the wood has given the wine an extra dimension while the ripe fruitiness gives it an almost jammy character. As it develops it will broaden into an impressive, concentrated wine. Drink from 2022.
title: Domaine Jacques Prieur 2014  Corton-Bressandes

description: Rich while firm, this wine is structured and dense. It has great fruit potential that is still developing through the tight texture and the concentrated structure. It will be a fine wine, but give it time. Drink from 2020.
title: Chanson PâˆšÂ®re et Fils 2013 PerriâˆšÂ®res Premier Cru  (Meursault)

description: This is the annual release of a small, isolated vineyard block that's dry-farmed and named for the winemaker. The unctuous bottling shows luxurious aromas of baked black cherries, cinnamon, clove, cream and a touch of iron. The rich dark red-fruit flavors show on the sip, where the surrounding chaparral herbs invade the palate, offering dried sagebrush, eucalyptus and a wild mint sensation that last deep into the finish.
title: Boekenoogen 2014 Garrett's Vineyard Dryland Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: From a block of the mighty vineyard known to coax robust acidity and pretty aromatics from the grapes, this red completely delivers on both fronts, opening with an array of rose garden and cranberry-orange highlights. Full bodied and generously structured, it develops complexity in the glass, showing a depth of savory cardamom that's incredibly appealing.
title: Blue Farm 2013 Gap's Crown Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Rich, ripe and fruity, this wine wears its tannins easily. With layers of acidity, red-berry fruit and a dark, dry core, the wine is impressive and set to age. The aftertaste is both sweet with the generous fruit and dry with tannins, finishing firmly. Drink from 2020.
title: Albert Bichot 2014 Les Sorbets Premier Cru  (Morey-Saint-Denis)

description: Quite light in the glass, this 50-50 blend from La Encanta and La Rinconada vineyards is done in a refreshingly crisp style, with lime pith and nectarine flesh aromas. It's fresh and vibrant on the palate, where tons of chalky grip frame a sizzling lime zest acidity and flavors of river stone and chalk. It's a laser-focused, very tense and nervy wine.
title: Jamie Slone Wines 2014 Aloysius Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: This is a truly delicious wine, worthy of accolades no matter its gulpability, made in a pretty off-pink color from 80% Malbec and 20% Merlot and aged six months in stainless steel. Tangy and crisp, it sings on the palate, an undeniable reward of watermelon and mandarin orange that's got meat on its tender bones.
title: Young Inglewood 2015 Vin Clair RosâˆšÂ© (St. Helena)

description: This is a lovely, light-hearted yet complex 100% varietal wine that shows the beauty of a lighter touch and cooler climate. Cedar, herb and compost provide a wildness next to aromas of feral mushroom. Intriguing all the way around, this wine finishes in a burst of white pepper.
title: Waxwing 2013 Flocchini Vineyard Syrah (Sonoma Coast)

description: Enticing aromas of crushed stone, acacia flower, citrus and sea breeze lift out of the glass. The elegant, medium-bodied palate offers ripe yellow apple, mineral, dried herb and honey alongside well-integrated acidity. A note of candied citrus zest gives it a succulent but focused finish.
title: Vivera 2012 Salisire Bianco  (Etna)

description: This famous site was planted in 1972 by Dick Erath, and the 44-year-old vines deliver an aromatic, elegant yet substantive bottle of Pinot. It's a complex mix of wild berries, cherries and chocolate, showing the generous flavors of the vintage. Delicious already, it's got the power and presence to age gracefully through 2023.
title: Vidon Vineyard 2012 Maresh Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: This selection from a 40-year-old vineyard manages to convey both power and complexity in a transparent, nearly ephemeral style. Like gazing into a clear pool of deep water, you plunge through a surface patina of ripe, crushed raspberries into a textural, evanescent palate framed in dark chocolate. Drink now through 2030 and beyond.
title: The Eyrie Vineyards 2013 Daphne Estate Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: This extremely flavorful wine smells like fig, almond and custard, and tastes like butterscotch, lemon meringue and toasted almond. It is quite full bodied, almost thick in texture and about to burst at the seams with richness.
title: Skinner 2013 Seven Generations White (El Dorado)

description: From a vineyard planted in 1981 above Cupertino comes this cellar-ready bottling that shows tobacco, cigar box, loamy earth, dried plums, leather deep black cherry and blueberry on the nose. Zesty acidity and chalky tannins frame the complete and powerful palate, where flavors of cedar, tobacco and woody berries converge. Drink 2020 through 2033.
title: Santa Cruz Mountain Vineyard 2013 Luchessi Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Trollinger, also known as Schiava or Vernatsch outside of Germany, is a rarity in the U.S. market, but this delightfully crisp, raspberrry-scented bottling is worth seeking out. It releases sweet raspberry and cherry perfume, but also darker notes of smoke, granite and cedar. Cranberry and strawberry flavors are tingling and tart, framed by tight tannins and a deep granite finish. Drinks well now but should improve further from 2021.
title: Wachtstetter 2013 Steillage Trollinger (WâˆšÂºrttemberg)

description: Immediately this Syrah-led blend registers as something special. Ripe berry and herb aromas are spicy, fresh and textbook for Chile. A full, dense, chewy palate is potent but under control. Flavors of olive, spice, coffee, toast and dark fruits finish with barrel spice, a final wave of black-fruit flavor and notes of juniper and eucalyptus. Drink through 2021.
title: Loma Larga 2012 Unfiltered Rapsodia Red (Casablanca Valley)

description: Polished but concentrated, fruity but complex, this beautifully shaped wine is simply delicious. While fairly full-bodied, it has an elegant texture, focused black-cherry flavors, harmonious and moderate oak notes. This is so tempting to drink now, but will be best after 2019.
title: Lazy Creek 2014 Middleridge Ranch Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: A fresh array of boysenberry, black raspberry, white pepper, crushed violet and dried lavender show on the nose of this bottling by Michael Larner. It's a very lively wine on the sip, with more boysenberry and black pepper as well as crushed lilac character.
title: Larner 2012 Elemental Red (Ballard Canyon)

description: This producer is showing true skill with this variety, vibrant in red and black cherry and cassis. Bright and satisfyingly generous on the palate, it's succulent as well as being earthy, with lingering layers of black pepper and cinnamon. It never gets heavy or burdensome, maintaining a fleetness of freshness that's irresistible.
title: Kokomo 2014 Grenache (Dry Creek Valley)

description: This wine by winemaker and owner Dan Kessler offers a zesty nose of crushed boysenberry, black raspberry, scarlet rose petal, wild sage and a touch of violet. There is lots of fresh zip to the sip, where woody elderberries and black plum are lifted by mint and more lively violet character. The finish is laced with juniper.
title: Kessler-Haak 2012 Ohana Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: While the attack of this dry wine is akin to biting into a perfectly ripened white peach, notes of salt and slate accumulate on the palate, lending a profound impression of minerality. The mouthfeel is rich and full bodied, yet high-toned acidity adds structure and a prolonged finish. It's drinking well now, but still quite taut and should open gorgeously through 2025.
title: Robert Weil 2014 Kiedrich Turmberg Trocken Riesling (Rheingau)

description: Two fistfuls of Merlot help soften this wine, along with 5% Petit Verdot. These grapes contribute to the full-bodied spirit and youthful tannin make-up that becomes plush and lush as it goes, revealing sizable elements of mocha, black currant and vanilla-tinged oak. Drink now through 2020.
title: Prime Solum 2012 Broken Rock Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: This wine is ripe in strawberry-raspberry notes. It's lush and velvety, with a richness that will appeal to those who like a hint of decadence in their Pinot. Round and soft, with a bite of earthiness throughout, it brightens with a trace of minerality on the finish.
designation: Don Miguel Vineyard Earthquake Block Estate Grown & Estate Bottled Unfiltered
title: Marimar Estate 2012 Don Miguel Vineyard Earthquake Block Estate Grown & Estate Bottled Unfiltered Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Lovely aromas of rose, violet, perfumed berry, mint and a balsamic note waft from the glass. The elegant palate delivers crushed red cherry, wild strawberry, orange zest, savory herb and cinnamon. It's balanced with fine-grained tannins and loaded with finesse.
title: Marchesi de' Frescobaldi 2011 Pinot Nero (Pomino)

description: Yeast, lovage and yellow pear unite in an ultrasavory GrâˆšÂºner that honors the variety's nickname of pfefferlâ€šÃ„Ã®the peppery one. The flavor base rests on green pear and fresh lemon, but the spice ratchets everything up a notch, and the lovely pepper lingers. Incredibly appetizing, this wine calls for light, savory dishes.
title: Loimer 2014 Langenlois GrâˆšÂºner Veltliner (Kamptal)

description: With just over 75% of the fruit coming from Seven Hills and the rest from the winery's young Ferguson vineyard, this wine offers a lot of enjoyment. Aromas suggest herb, cocoa, mineral and an assortment of blue fruit. The flavors are simultaneously luscious yet restrained, backed by firm tannins that should benefit from additional time in the bottle.
title: L'Ecole No. 41 2012 Estate Grown Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: Cedar, graphite, marzipan, black plum and blackberry aromas ooze power and ripeness. This is concentrated and dark in style, with oaky blackberry and cassis flavors. Spice, vanilla, raisin, cassis and chocolate flavors reflect maximum ripeness, while the finish is dense, layered and potent. Drink this hefty, extracted Malbec through 2020.
title: Lamadrid 2012 Single Vineyard Gran Reserva Malbec (Agrelo)

description: Purists might be inclined to say this wine is too oaky, but this reviewer believes there's ample substance to support the flash. Cedar and vanilla are apparent, but the dominating characteristics of this wine are its ripe fruit and plush texture. Drink nowâ€šÃ„Ã¬2020.
title: Jules Taylor 2013 OTQ Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: This bold, well-structured wine is packed with both rich fruit and tannins. Dense black fruits are layered with a dry, firm structure, with power and concentration for medium-term aging. Drink this wine from 2018.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2012  Gevrey-Chambertin

description: Rich and heady on the nose in petrol and sublime vanilla crâˆšÂ®me brâˆšÂªlâˆšÂ©e, the palate is intriguingly more restrained, offering honey and pear balanced by persistent minerality that finds its voice most forcefully on the lean, refreshing finish.
title: JCB 2012 No. 33 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: After starting out somewhat reduced, this becomes aromatic with notes of char, coffee grounds, toast, herbs and dark cherries. It's seamless, silky and rich in feel, with layered fruit and barrel flavors and a beguiling sense of texture.
title: J. Bookwalter 2012 Foreshadow Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Made with organically farmed fruit, this richly structured wine opens with aromas that recall spiced plum, underbrush, tobacco and a hint of espresso. The savory palate doles out ripe black cherry, nectarine zest, baking spice and mineral, while velvety tannins provide support.
title: Il Conventino 2010 Riserva  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

description: A jubilant bouquet of orange blossoms, marmalade and stony minerals, this unctuous ice wine is profoundly aromatic and complex. Rich and nectar-like, yet not at all cloying on the palate, it's anchored by a piercing vein of acidity that's thrilling with every sip. Spicy, sweet and lavishly creamy, it lingers endlessly on the finish.
title: Hazlitt 1852 Vineyards 2013 Ice Wine Vidal Blanc (Finger Lakes)

description: Layers of wild strawberry on the nose and palate make for an inviting entry into this wine that is medium in body and weight. Velvety smooth in texture, it's balanced on the palate, with a shock of earthy intrigue on the finish.
title: Hawley 2012 Love Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Ripe black fruit, red currant, cedar, mocha, savory herb and game sensations characterize this blend of Cabernet Franc, Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Petit Verdot. Balanced with velvety tannins, the soft palate closes on a licorice note. Drink through 2019.
title: Tenuta di Biserno 2009 Il Pino Red (Toscana)

description: A remarkable shade of slightly purple bubblegum, Kathy Joseph's wine shows strawberries and buttery croissants on the nose. The flavors are boisterous and nearly effervescent, with berries, yeast and a long-lasting sense of strawberry mousse. This one goes down all too easy.
title: Fiddlehead Cellars 2014 Pink Fiddle RosâˆšÂ© of Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: While still closed on the nose, this has hints of green and yellow pear that shine through. A slender but very appetizing juiciness on the palate is light but full of freshness and flavor. Yeast, aloe vera and herbal spice add even more pleasure. It's a gorgeous, refreshing wine from a challenging vintage.
title: Eichinger 2014 Hasel GrâˆšÂºner Veltliner (Kamptal)

description: This is a beautiful, bright wine, still very young although already hinting at the warmth of Fourchaume. The steely texture is right up front, along with crisp apple and citrus fruits. Underneath, a vanilla, toasty character shows promise for aging. Drink from 2017.
title: Domaine Vrignaud 2013 Fourchaume Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: A short wood-aging has given this wine an extra dimension that's both ripe and ageworthy. Yellow fruits are spiced up by the toast and ginger flavors, whlle intense background acidity provides wonderful freshness. This wine deserves to age. Drink from 2017.
title: Domaine Sangouard-Guyot 2013 Quintessence  (Pouilly-FuissâˆšÂ©)

description: With its ripe red fruits and crisp acidity, this has a brightness that exudes charm and freshness. The aftertaste brings out a more textured character from a tangy orange zest flavor.
title: Domaine Saint-AndrâˆšÂ© de FiguiâˆšÂ®re 2014 PremiâˆšÂ®re de FiguiâˆšÂ®re RosâˆšÂ© (CâˆšÂ¥tes de Provence)

description: This wine from Houchart's selective Sainte-Victoire appellation is distinct from the Quiot family's other Houchart rosâˆšÂ©s. This wine is rich and full on the palate, without losing any sense of acidity or freshness. It's ready to drink although it will be better from the end of 2015.
title: Domaine Houchart 2014 RosâˆšÂ© (CâˆšÂ¥tes de Provence Sainte-Victoire)

description: This is wonderfully supple and approachable, light on the palate yet not lacking for flavor. Hints of violets and toast flame silky cherry fruit which glides easily through the long finish. Drink nowâ€šÃ„Ã¬2018.
title: Craggy Range 2012 Te Muna Road Pinot Noir (Martinborough)

description: Somewhat light in color, this wine offers pleasing notes of flowers, milk chocolate, vanilla extract, herbs and carob. It's light and silky in feel with abundant milk chocolate and cherry flavors that linger.
title: Cloudlift Cellars 2012 Ascent Cabernet Franc (Horse Heaven Hills)

description: Peppery and crisp, this is a ripe and fruity wine. A bite of spice and tangy orange zest adds character to the peach and red berry fruits. It's a rich wine that could age, so drink from 2015.
title: ChâˆšÂ¢teau Saint-Maur 2014 L'Excellence RosâˆšÂ© (CâˆšÂ¥tes de Provence)

description: This vigorous blend of Grenache (60%), Cinsault (20%, Tibouren (10%) and Syrah (10%) has a good balance between rich fruits and the freshest acidity. While there is a crisp, tangy background, the foreground is ripe with strawberries and apricots. The whole thing is finished with a lively, bright aftertaste.
title: ChâˆšÂ¢teau Minuty 2014 Prestige RosâˆšÂ© (CâˆšÂ¥tes de Provence)

description: This is a soft and ripe wine, full of rounded red berry fruits. The fruit is boosted by its acidity to give a fresh feel. The texture is soft, with a shot of pepper to add complexity at the end.
title: ChâˆšÂ¢teau LâˆšÂ©oube 2014 RosâˆšÂ© de LâˆšÂ©oube RosâˆšÂ© (CâˆšÂ¥tes de Provence)

description: Both smooth and beautifully fruity, this is a balanced, delicious wine. It is full of wild strawberry flavors, the freshest acidity and a crisp finish with great acidity. It's a good choice with food and as an apâˆšÂ©ritif.
title: ChâˆšÂ¢teau de Roquefort 2014 Corail RosâˆšÂ© (CâˆšÂ¥tes de Provence)

description: Native yeast was used in this block selection, a big-boned, almost chunky wine with flavors of dried plums and sesame candy. It has a pleasantly oily mouthfeel, and a finishing lick of hazelnuts.
title: CedarCreek 2012 Block 4 Platinum Pinot Noir (Okanagan Valley)

description: Aromas of violet, chocolate, woodland berry, leather and a whiff of meat juices lead the nose on this full-bodied wine. On the palate, juicy black cherry and crushed raspberry take center stage while accents of espresso, cedar, white pepper and menthol play supporting roles. It's balanced with bright acidity and assertive tannins. Drink 2016â€šÃ„Ã¬2022.
title: Castello di Meleto 2010 Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

description: This is a meticulously crafted blend of 50% Sangiovese, 24% Merlot, 18% Cabernet Sauvignon and 8% Petit Verdot from four vineyards spread throughout the appellation. Soft and plush, the nose shows dried strawberries, pork fat and a touch of black truffle. The hedonistic palate offers dried cherries, warm fudge and chewy tannins.
title: Carhartt Vineyard 2012 il Grande Gallo Red (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: The nose on this single-vineyard wine from a strong, often overlooked appellation is tight and minerally before showing a slightly tropical kiwi element. Brightly acidic on the lively palate, flavors range from Key lime and Meyer lemon to pear skins and apple flesh.
title: Blair 2013 Roger Rose Vineyard Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

description: Bright and refined, this conveys aromas of dark berry, tobacco, smoke and underbrush. The vibrant palate delivers juicy wild cherry, orange zest, cinnamon and a note of licorice alongside firm, fine-grained tannins and fresh acidity. Drink 2015â€šÃ„Ã¬2012.
title: Bindella 2011  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano

description: This simple, no-fuss Prosecco opens with cheery aromas of peach, yellow rose and a touch of bitter almond. This expression also offers mature flavors of melon and apricot on the finish.
title: Bianca Vigna 2010 Brut Millesimato  (Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

description: A pretty good Pinot Noir, elegantly silky as it should be, with flavors of tart cherries, cola, red licorice and sandalwood. It's a bit too soft and sweet, but easy to drink.
title: Belle Glos 2010 Meiomi Pinot Noir (Monterey-Santa Barbara-Sonoma)

description: A sound introductory Pinot Noir, showing proper silkiness and spicy flavors of cherries and cola. Easy to drink, with no obvious faults.
title: Arrow Creek 2010 Coastal Series Pinot Noir (California)

description: Sweet and extracted in pineapple, tangerine, lime and vanilla flavors, this Chardonnay also is generously oaked, which gives it even richer vanilla and buttered toast notes. It's flashy, yet would benefit from greater dryness and restraint. Size isn't everything.
title: Anaba 2009 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Feels heavy and jammy in the mouth, with raspberry and cherry flavors that are generously oaked. That barrel aging regime brings butterscotch and sweet vanilla to the mix. The result is a rather soft, sweet Pinot Noir whose richness outweighs its complexity.
title: ZD 2009 Norman C. deLeuze Founder's Reserve Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: A solid Zinfandel, dry and stylish. Not a blockbuster, just a well-crafted wine that offers nice berry, cherry, tobacco and spice flavors.
title: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2010 Zinfandel (California)

description: The name and packaging scream â€šÃ„Ãºconcept wine,â€šÃ„Ã¹ but what's in the bottle will win you over. It's full and rubbery, with pleasant yet generic berry aromas. The palate is racy and fairly hefty and tannic, with black raspberry, plum and mild herbal flavors. Grabby, with good acidity on the finish.
title: Vintage Sun 2010 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)

description: A fruity wine, full of grapefruit, lime and melon flavors, cut with passion fruit acidity. The wine has a light texture with a zesty edge, clean and totally ready to drink. Screwcap.
title: Villebois 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

description: Il Fresco is the perfect bubbly for a moonlit night, a festive atmosphere and dining al fresco. Light and luminous with an easy feel and focused floral and peach aromas, this bright Prosecco is a real charmer.
title: Villa Sandi NV Il Fresco Brut  (Prosecco)

description: Here's an absolutely terrific, but informal sparkling rosâˆšÂ© from southern Italy (made with Negroamaro grapes). Sweet berry, chopped mint and peach come to the fore and the wine is soft and slightly sweet. It's easy, fresh and would make a great cocktail choice.
title: Villa Mottura NV RosâˆšÂ© Extra Dry Negroamaro (Salento)

description: A sound red wine, dry and full-bodied, with pleasant berry, herb, currant and smoked meat flavors that finish rich and sweet in ripe fruit. The winery doesn't reveal what varieties are in the blend.
title: Grandmaster 2009 Red (Paso Robles)

description: Full in the mouth, laced with texture and acidity, this red currant-flavored wine is crisp, with an herbal character, ready to drink but could last over the winter.
title: Fournier PâˆšÂ®re et Fils 2010 Les Belles Vignes RosâˆšÂ© Pinot Noir (Sancerre)

description: Tastes like a Chardonnay, with tropical fruit, peach and green apple flavors wrapped into buttercream and vanilla. Ripe and sweet, but balanced by crisp acidity. A nice, rich white wine for drinking now.
title: Valley of the Moon 2010 Pinot Blanc (Sonoma County)

description: Epineuil is a small area close to Chablis. This red wine is as light and fresh as its northerly location would suggest. Red cherry juice dominates an attractively textured wine that could be served slightly chilled.
title: Simonnet-Febvre 2008 Epineuil  (Bourgogne)

description: There's a grassy, dry element to the nose of this Brut Prosecco that resembles dried oregano or basil. Beyond that is a simple but fresh mouthfeel characterized by foamy perlage.
title: Scandolera NV Costa d'Oro Brut  (Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

description: Lots of ripe red cherry, pomegranate, cola and sandalwood flavors in this dry Pinot Noir. It lacks vibrant acidity to give life to the richness. Drink now.
title: Rossi Wallace 2010 Pinot Noir (Napa Valley)

description: Very red and slightly grassy on the nose, with aromas of strawberry, mint leaf and rhubarb. It's a juicy screamer in the mouth, with intensity, blazing acidity and wild raspberry and plum flavors. Dry, tight and long on the finish.
title: Ricardo Santos 2009 La Madras Vineyard Malbec (Mendoza)

description: Martha Clara's Riesling is dry in style yet soft on the palate with sweet tones of honeyed apples and white peach. Fresh and juicy with a mouthwatering acidity, it finishes on a puckery lemonade note.
title: Martha Clara 2009 Riesling (North Fork of Long Island)

description: High-toned and citric on the nose, with foresty spice and a whiff of the ocean. Tight and nervy in the mouth, with herbal, spicy red plum flavors that are true to the variety. Honest but a touch lean and fiery on the finish.
title: Leyda 2010 Classic Pinot Noir (Leyda Valley)

description: Perfect for a glass or two before dinner, this light Prosecco Brut delivers crisp tones of citrus, white flower and lime juice. This cheerful Italian sparkling wine does a great job of keeping the palate refreshed and tonic.
title: Le Vigne di Alice NV Doro Brut  (Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

description: Here's a steely and tonic Brut Prosecco with drying mineral notes followed by white flower and dried herbs. The sharply sparkling nature of this wine would match appetizers topped by cream or cheese.
title: Le Manzane 2010 Brut  (Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

description: A big-boy Syrah named for the producer's daughter, this is a jammy, juicy, brown sugar and maple syrup kind of Syrah, with a great peppery nose and a lot of bacon fat flavors intermingled among the soft tannins.
title: Klinker Brick 2009 Farrah Syrah (Lodi)

description: All is proper and well done in this Cabernet, from the dryness and smooth tannins to the flavors of blackberries, currants and cedar. It's a little thin, but the price is pretty good.
title: Kirkland Signature 2009 NAPA Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa County)

description: Lots of ripe, forward blackberry and cherry fruit in this likeable wine. It's a little on the sweet, simple side, but nicely crafted, and the price is good for what you get.
title: Kirkland Signature 2008 Meritage (Napa Valley)

description: Light notes of red cherry lozenge and strawberry mark the medium-bodied palate, which is structured with tense, snappy acidity.
title: Chateau Morrisette 2011 Dry RosâˆšÂ© Chambourcin (Virginia)

description: There are some good things going on here but it feels like they are struggling to get to the surface with lees notes and alcoholic warmth overwhelming the palate's appealing, creamy texture.
title: Telaya 2012 Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: The aromas are quite faint here but the apricot flavors are in abundance on this off-dry, medium-bodied easy drinker.
title: Radius 2012 Chardonnay (Washington)

description: While this boxed wine smells a touch weedy and stalky, with airing you could call it â€šÃ„Ãºherbalâ€šÃ„Ã¹ in a good way. Mildly green flavors of blackberry and plum finish solid enough. This is generic wine with both good and shaky qualities.
title: Black Box 2012 Malbec (Mendoza)

description: Too ripe, with red currant and raisin skin flavors giving it a bitterness despite some tasty chocolate and cherry jam richness. The alcohol feels high, leading to a hot finish.
title: a-non-ah-mus 2010 Alisos Vineyard Grenache (Santa Barbara County)

description: Light in color, this is a tight, cherry fruited wine with fruit that seems underripe. It's almost rosâˆšÂ© in feel with just a leather and tannin underlay to give it structure. Drink now.
title: Pierre and Charles Sparr 2011 CuvâˆšÂ©e Tradition Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: A sweet-smelling wine with notes of overripe pear, pineapple and jasmine. It also drinks quite sweet (26g/L residual sugar) but doesn't have the acid or flavor concentration to match.
title: Paradise Peak 2012 Riesling (Washington)

description: This is a bone dry, tannic, rather austere wine. It has suggestions of cherry skins and red licorice, with brisk acidity. Not an ager, it needs rich, fatty meats and cheeses for balance.
title: MillâˆšÂ©simâˆšÂ© 2010 Cabernet Franc (Santa Barbara County)

description: It's keen in acidity and somewhat overripe, with the taste of prune macaroons. It's also pretty tannic. Doesn't seem likely to develop with age.
title: Whitcraft 2012 Pence Ranch Clone 2A Pinot Noir (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: Heavy white-fruit aromas have an almost â€šÃ„Ãºcannedâ€šÃ„Ã¹ quality. This is more like citrus juice than defined white wine, with hugely ripe tropical and citrus flavors culminating in creamy weight. This is 80% Godello and 20% DoâˆšÂ±a Blanca.
title: Godelia 2012 Godello-DoâˆšÂ±a Blanca White (Bierzo)

description: Dry and somewhat heavy, it has cherry jam and oak flavors.
title: Geyser Peak 2012 Pluto's Fury Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This simple wine holds somewhat oxidized aromas of caramelized orange slices and flint that carry over to the palate along with lemon-lime.
title: Feudi del Pisciotto 2012 Baglio del Sole Inzolia (Terre Siciliane)

description: Chewing gum, plum and raspberry aromas are raw and suggestive of grape skins. The wine is juicy but without much body or spine. Flavors of generic red fruits and watermelon finish rubbery and slightly bitter. Drink in 2014.
title: Cruz de Piedra 2013 Garnacha RosâˆšÂ© (Calatayud)

description: Toasted popcorn kernel is the chief note. Medium in body, it bears simple pomaceous flavors and even-keeled acids.
title: Chateau Morrisette 2011 Chardonnay (Virginia)

description: This deep golden, almost amber-colored wine is showing signs of oxidation. It has an unusual and intensely balsamic nose while the palate offers muddled sensations of eucalyptus, lemon drop, mineral and a hint of candied ginger but no fruit richness.
title: Cantine Astroni 2009 Strione Falanghina (Campania)

description: It has silky texture, brisk acidity and pleasant cherry, cola, tobacco and spice flavors.
title: Annabella 2012 Special Selection Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: Some barnyard flavors give a rustic character. Fruit and acidity are there, leaving a wine with a crisp aftertaste even if not losing the rougher element.
title: Les MaâˆšÃ†tres Vignerons de la Presqu'âˆšÃ†le de Saint-Tropez 2013 Cep d'Or RosâˆšÂ© (CâˆšÂ¥tes de Provence)
winery: Les MaâˆšÃ†tres Vignerons de la Presqu'âˆšÃ†le de Saint-Tropez

description: A rosâˆšÂ© of 100% MourvâˆšÂ®dre, this bears mild flavors of red cherry, candied strawberry and tropical fruit, which are enlivened by fresh acidity. It's a simple rosâˆšÂ© that would be an enjoyable accompaniment to a picnic lunch.
title: Stinson 2012 RosâˆšÂ© (Monticello)

description: This 100% varietal wine shows the difficulties of making MourvâˆšÂ®dre in California. The wine is bone dry and rather dull, with black cherry, tobacco and oak flavors.
title: Tablas Creek 2011 MourvâˆšÂ®dre (Paso Robles)

description: This has intense aromas of spearmint and eucalyptus. The palate is lean, with licorice and mineral but not enough fruit.
title: Pierluigi Zampaglione 2010 Don Chisciotte Fiano (Campania)

description: Crisp and dry, this is a medium-bodied, slightly austere wine. Hints of smoke or stuck flint join with grapefruit rind on the nose, while a slightly bitter note appears on the palate and persists through the finish.
title: Wild South 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: The orange, lemon, honey and vanilla flavors are a little thin, but crisp acidity and a sweet finish make the wine likeable, perhaps nice on a summer night.
title: Villa Andriana 2013 Muscat Canelli (Knights Valley)

description: Floral and lightly tropical on the nose, and totally pleasant. The palate is pure and lively, with elegance and some spritz. Flavors of nectarine, peach and melon are fresh, and the wine finishes easy and smooth. Very nice; just short of excellent but still it's 100% quaffable.
title: Finca de Arantei 2010 Single Vineyard AlbariâˆšÂ±o (Râˆšâ‰ as Baixas)

description: A lovely balance of red fruit and soft texture that's quite enjoyable over the length of a meal from Napa-based Elyse, which sources the red RhâˆšÂ¥ne varietals in this wine from a high-elevation vineyard in the Sierra Foothills.
title: Elyse 2007 C'est Si Bon G-S-M (Sierra Foothills)

description: Sweet and spicy on the nose with mouthwatering scents of honey, plum compote and anise, this Cab icewine is rich and syrupy on the tongue with a deep core of plummy flavors. Flashes of vibrant acidity add elegance and a clean, long finish.
title: Konzelmann 2007 Icewine Cabernet Sauvignon (Niagara Peninsula)

description: A great expression of the terroir, this rosâˆšÂ© made from 50% Syrah, 40% Grenanche and 10% Cinsault is loaded with garrigue accents (lavender and thyme) among the fresh strawberry and cherry fruit core. Clean and zippy on the finish with a lingering soft spice accent.
title: ChâˆšÂ¢teau de Lancyre 2010 Pic Saint-Loup RosâˆšÂ© (Coteaux du Languedoc)

description: Plenty of wood aromas, but the palate combines the wood notes with smoky acidity, textured green plum and vanilla flavors with a refreshing acidity. There's a tang here: a wine that has bursts of great fruit to go with the wood.
title: Chanson PâˆšÂ®re et Fils 2008 Hauts-Marconnets Premier Cru  (Savigny-lâˆšÂ®s-Beaune)

description: This rich, oak-driven Merlot from Sicily opens with bright cherry and blueberry backed by toasted almond, leather and pipe tobacco. There's a raw or chewy note in the mouth that will soften with a few more months of bottle aging.
title: Baglio di Pianetto 2006 Salici Merlot (Sicilia)

description: This full-bodied, even slightly viscous, effort from Penfolds displays dark notes of blackberry and chocolate on the nose, then adds touches of coffee and black olive into the mix on the palate before finishing tangy and crisp. Drink nowâ€šÃ„Ã¬2016.
title: Penfolds 2008 Bin 2 Shiraz-MourvâˆšÂ®dre (South Australia)
